commit_message:
Horizon django cache compress on ubuntu

Change splits the exec for the manage.py to be split into collectstatic
and compress. Previously, both actions were only executed on redhat but
ubuntu requires compress on config change too.

Change-Id: Ib7238f9bc107c372759d1ebbeb88469806267769
Closes-Bug: #1599536
(cherry picked from commit 62b4476db480bdddb3b3953cc4a88529a1bb55f1)

commit_message:
Add destroyed container context manager

Required for running destroy docker contaier before code block and
startup it after block

Usage:

    from octane.util import docker

    with docker.destoyed_container("container_name"):
       ...

Change-Id: Iab57665d2b345bc19f04fad4c0cd4a4e461edd89
(cherry picked from commit 44beb3932b8416ff4df7c9c9caf9206ecebe89f9)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-octane refs/changes/71/337671/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def destroy_container(container): _container_action(container, "destroy") def check_container(container): _container_action(container, "check")

commit_message:
Upgrade rework

1. Rebased on upgrade_ceph_ha_restore
  (master node is 8.0, fuel-octane is already installed)
2. Extended tests amount to upgrade whole cluster and check every step
  (previously checks was skipped)
3. Run on remote helper: logging is aligned to the modern ssh manager for easier debugging
  (use str instead of list of binary strings -> human readable error output. Related bug found)

Related-Bug:1585194
Change-Id: Ibee784b9cc4be8b2628e7646c51a21910febbb9e
(cherry picked from commit 1e69474)

commit_message:
Upgrade rework

1. Rebased on upgrade_ceph_ha_restore
  (master node is 8.0, fuel-octane is already installed)
2. Extended tests amount to upgrade whole cluster and check every step
  (previously checks was skipped)
3. Run on remote helper: logging is aligned to the modern ssh manager for easier debugging
  (use str instead of list of binary strings -> human readable error output. Related bug found)

Related-Bug:1585194
Change-Id: Ibee784b9cc4be8b2628e7646c51a21910febbb9e
(cherry picked from commit 1e69474)
(cherry picked from commit c404a62)

Remove instance_user tests

The parameter was removed in 3b49812852e8f672a5be64d026e95cbda50d00ef
and support for it no longer exists in heat.

commit_message:
Adjust timeout for non-retry calls

Give non-retry calls the full timeout seconds to finish and also
don't log that you're going to retry them when you are not.

(cherry picked from commit I51cbe3905b55f035718245b45bfc34536b8ce602)
Closes-bug: 1602208

Note: most of the patch has been included in other backport merge
conflict resolution, that's why so few is left of it.  But the piece is
critical to fix the above bug.

Change-Id: I5921df520d12eb2e89ccd21f7ff0b7cfe46b231d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-openstacklib refs/changes/81/340881/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: action = args[1] Timeout.timeout(command_timeout(action)) do
deleted_lines: Timeout.timeout(command_timeout) do raise exception if no_retry_actions.include? action

commit_message:
Explicit conditional with ensure statement

The ensure conditional allowed any value other than present
to ensure absent an osd. If the user had mistakenly put the
value at 'presen' or 'presentt' it would remove the OSD.
The conditional has been update prevents any value other than
either present or absent from being acceptable.

Change-Id: I7440544518ae5f830a76c2ae222d8b8610b0c97d

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-12 15:09:31.000000000', 'files': ['docs/monasca-api-spec.md'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/monasca-api/commit/afbb229dfb94a4cc261d87f1ec42ba4a565d72c6', 'message': 'Fix update notification method doc

Change-Id: I1b2b060385d676a98a1f7a2c4e7216c3dbf346ed

commit_message:
Fix update notification method doc

When updating notification method, period is required instead of optional

Change-Id: I1b2b060385d676a98a1f7a2c4e7216c3dbf346ed
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/monasca-api refs/changes/94/340994/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: * period (integer, required) - The interval in seconds to periodically send the notification. Only can be set as a non zero value for WEBHOOK methods. Allowed periods for Webhooks by default are 0, 60. You can change allow periods for webhooks in the api config. The notification will continue to be sent at the defined interval until the alarm it is associated with changes state.
deleted_lines: * period (integer, optional) - The interval in seconds to periodically send the notification. Only can be set as a non zero value for WEBHOOK methods. Allowed periods for Webhooks by default are 0, 60. You can change allow periods for webhooks in the api config. The notification will continue to be sent at the defined interval until the alarm it is associated with changes state.

commit_message:
Add v2/quotas

This adds the quotas api from /admin to /v2 with some changes.

All users can GET /v2/quotas/<project_id>

Users with "All-Projects" permission can view other projects
(by setting X-Auth-All-Projects:True in the HTTP Headers)

Users with "All-Projects" and "set-quotas" can set other
projects quotas

Moved the API rendering to Designate Object based rendering

Change-Id: I7a0b828824ad6f274d922748f5f9a68157cd939a
Depends-On: I06180a7402fc45940d4b312666cf2dfd33af1305

deleted_lines: 'id', 'resource', 'tenant_id', 'hard_limit'

commit_message:
Add baremetal-multitenancy guide

The guide describes how Ironic Neutron integration works.
It contains howto:
 * enable ML2 plugin in Neutron
 * configure Ironic to support multitenancy

Implements: blueprint ironic-ml2-integration

Change-Id: I4fe5dc57dbd8e022fd8597eca7c072850004cc76
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/25/321025/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. _baremetal_miltitenancy: ========================================== Configure and use multitenancy with Ironic ========================================== This configuration allows creating a dedicated tenant network, which extends the current Ironic capabilities of providing ``flat`` networks. This works in conjunction with Neutron to allow for provisioning of the Bare Metal server onto the tenant network. The result is that multiple tenants can now deploy in an isolated fashion. Ironic provides ``local_link_connection`` information to Neutron ML2 driver. ML2 driver uses that information to plug specified port to tenant network. .. list-table:: ``local_link_connection`` fields :header-rows: 1 * - Field - Description * - switch_id - (required) used to identify a switch and could be an LLDP based MAC address or an OpenFlow based datapath_id * - port_id - (required) port ID on the switch. For example Gig0/1 * - switch_info - (optional) used to distinguish different switch models or some other vendor specific identifier Configure Neutron ML2 driver ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Add your ML2 driver to ``/etc/neutron/plugins/ml2/ml2_conf.ini``. Add vendor ML2 plugin configuration options. For more details see the `Neutron Mechanism Drivers <https://github.com/openstack/openstack-manuals/blob/master/doc/networking-guide/source/config-ml2-plug-in.rst#mechanism-drivers>`__. .. code-block:: ini [ml2] ... mechanism_drivers = my_mechanism_driver [my_vendor] param_1=... param_2=... param_3=... Configure Ironic ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ On ``ironic-conductor`` update ``/etc/ironic/ironic.conf``: .. code-block:: ini [DEFAULT] ... enabled_network_interfaces=flat,neutron [neutron] ... cleaning_network_uuid=$UUID provisioning_network_uuid=$UUID The network_interface should be set to valid network driver that is used to switching to cleaning/provisioning networks. For example set to neutron to use Neutron ML2 driver. .. code-block:: console $ironic node-create -n $NAME --network-interface neutron Create a port with appropriate ``local_link_connection`` information .. code-block:: console ironic --ironic-api-version latest port-create -a $HW_MAC_ADDRESS \ -n $NODE_UUID -l switch_id=$SWITCH_MAC_ADDRESS \ -l switch_info=$SWITCH_HOSTNAME -l port_id=$SWITCH_PORT --pxe-enabled true Examples ~~~~~~~~ Example of configuration Devstack with ``networking-generic-switch`` ML2 Neutron driver. Complete ``local.conf`` example: .. code-block:: console MYSQL_PASSWORD=secretmysql DATABASE_PASSWORD=secretdatabase RABBIT_PASSWORD=secretrabbit ADMIN_PASSWORD=secretadmin SERVICE_PASSWORD=secretservice # Enable Ironic API and Ironic Conductor enable_service ironic enable_service ir-api enable_service ir-cond # Enable Neutron which is required by Ironic and disable nova-network. disable_service n-net disable_service n-novnc enable_service q-svc enable_service q-agt enable_service q-dhcp enable_service q-l3 enable_service q-meta enable_service neutron # Enable Swift for agent_* drivers enable_service s-proxy enable_service s-object enable_service s-container enable_service s-account # Swift temp URL's are required for agent_* drivers. SWIFT_ENABLE_TEMPURLS=True # Create 3 virtual machines to pose as Ironic's baremetal nodes. IRONIC_VM_COUNT=3 IRONIC_VM_SSH_PORT=22 IRONIC_BAREMETAL_BASIC_OPS=True # Enable Ironic drivers. IRONIC_ENABLED_DRIVERS=fake,agent_ssh,agent_ipmitool,pxe_ssh,pxe_ipmitool # Change this to alter the default driver for nodes created by devstack. # This driver should be in the enabled list above. IRONIC_DEPLOY_DRIVER=agent_ssh # The parameters below represent the minimum possible values to create # functional nodes. IRONIC_VM_SPECS_RAM=1024 IRONIC_VM_SPECS_DISK=10 # Size of the ephemeral partition in GB. Use 0 for no ephemeral partition. IRONIC_VM_EPHEMERAL_DISK=0 # To build your own IPA ramdisk from source, set this to True IRONIC_BUILD_DEPLOY_RAMDISK=False VIRT_DRIVER=ironic # By default, DevStack creates a 10.0.0.0/24 network for instances. # If this overlaps with the hosts network, you may adjust with the # following. NETWORK_GATEWAY=10.1.0.1 FIXED_RANGE=10.1.0.0/24 FIXED_NETWORK_SIZE=256 # Log all output to files LOGFILE=$HOME/devstack.log LOGDIR=$HOME/logs IRONIC_VM_LOG_DIR=$HOME/ironic-bm-logs IRONIC_ENABLED_NETWORK_INTERFACES=flat,neutron IRONIC_NETWORK_INTERFACE=neutron Launch ``./stack.sh``. Drink a cup of coffee. .. code-block:: console # Create SSH key nova keypair-add ironic_key > ironic_key.pem # Get user image_id image=$(nova image-list | egrep "cirros-0.3.4-x86_64-disk"'[^-]' | awk '{ print $2 }') # Get private network id net_id=$(neutron net-list | egrep "private"'[^-]' | awk '{ print $2 }') # Boot the instance nova boot --flavor baremetal --image $image --key-name ironic_key --nic net-id=$net_id vm_name # Check that during provision ironic node is in provision network. # Node will receive different IP during provision and in ACTIVE state. # Find provision provider:segmentation_id field. neutron net-show ironic-provision # VM port should be dynamically plugged to segmentation_id VLAN sudo ovs-vsctl show ... Port "ovs-vm-0" tag: 215 Interface "ovs-vm-0" type: internal ... # When node is in active state check that tag has been changed to private network. sudo ovs-vsctl show ... Port "ovs-vm-0" tag: 218 Interface "ovs-vm-0" type: internal ...

added_lines: - name: Clearwater demo tags: ['app'] provided_by: name: Konstantin Snihyr href: "mailto:ksnihyr@mirantis.com" company: Mirantis, Inc. description: > Clearwater is an open source implementation of IMS (the IP Multimedia Subsystem) designed from the ground up for massively scalable deployment in the Cloud to provide voice, video and messaging services to millions of users. Clearwater combines the economics of over-the-top style service platforms with the standards compliance expected of telco-grade communications network solutions, and its Cloud-oriented design makes it extremely well suited for deployment in a Network Functions Virtualization (NFV) environment. This application is PoC and demonstrate Murano capabilities in vIMS deploy service: type: murano format: package package_name: com.mirantis.clearwater.Clearwater release: - Mitaka license: Multi-licensed OpenSource depends: - name: BIND DNS server hash: cb0d37228d8f78b62b42964136f9a75b attributes: "Package URL": "http://storage.apps.openstack.org/apps/com.mirantis.clearwater.Clearwater.zip" "Source URL": "https://github.com/openstack/murano-apps/tree/master/Clearwater/package" - name: BIND DNS server tags: ['app'] provided_by: name: Konstantin Snihyr href: "mailto:ksnihyr@mirantis.com" company: Mirantis, Inc. description: > BIND is open source software that implements the Domain Name System (DNS) protocols for the Internet. It is a reference implementation of those protocols, but it is also production-grade software, suitable for use in high-volume and high-reliability applications. The name BIND stands for “Berkeley Internet Name Domain”, because the software originated in the early 1980s at the University of California at Berkeley. BIND is by far the most widely used DNS software on the Internet, providing a robust and stable platform on top of which organizations can build distributed computing systems with the knowledge that those systems are fully compliant with published DNS standards. service: type: murano format: package package_name: com.mirantis.network.dns.Bind release: - Mitaka license: Apache License, Version 2.0 hash: da88780bc2c08a1c56c358fe03566e35 attributes: "Package URL": "http://storage.apps.openstack.org/apps/com.mirantis.network.dns.Bind.zip" "Source URL": "https://github.com/openstack/murano-apps/tree/master/BIND/package"

commit_message:
Extra-spec as bool key does not clear host passes

Currently if we pass a bool key like foo=True as an extra-spec with
the create volume, it errors with no valid host found.This is because
the comparisons are happening between unicode string and bool values.
This patch corrects the behaviour by converting string to bool

Since the current behaviour allows string extra-spec keys to be set
this way, it would be good to have this for bool keys too.

Change-Id: I8112a6de9e6fa2f976950c70217a89246b2bd73a
Closes-bug: #1599611

Replace assertEqual(None, *) with assertIsNone in tests

clear messages in case of failure.

This change simply removes all of the named tags being used within the
repo-build playbook. Because the lookup needs to be executed everytime

Change-Id: I1ba96a731f22e65045370f43656b743943fed365
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Remove excessive tags

This change simply removes all of the named tags being used within the
repo-build playbook. Because the lookup needs to be executed everytime
the playbook is called it makes a lot more sense for this playbook to
use the "always" tag instead of a mix of all of the above.

Change-Id: I1ba96a731f22e65045370f43656b743943fed365
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/98/340598/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
fix other versions sidebar links

Make the first one link to the current docs and the others
link with the appropriate prefix.

Filtered out previous versions that include "rc".

The number of versions is kept at 5 (current + 4 recent).

Closes-Bug: #1589731
Change-Id: I3a2e219913fc2c89634bcc2a757ccb4d3510883a

subject: Use already Deployed/Installed servers
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-11 21:08:52.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/955418440205f7d61b2ae220f5698c10aed0731d', 'message': 'Use already Deployed/Installed servers

This patch provides a set of templates that enables
tripleo-heat-templates to be used with a set of already deployed,
installed, and running servers. In this method, Nova and Ironic are not
used to deploy any servers.

This approach is attractive for POC deployments where dedicated
provisioning networks are not available, or other server install methods
are dictated for various reasons.

This is highly a work in progress, and there are still some open
questions that may yet prove that this approach is not viable,
particularly around the ability to fully support different network
isolation setups.

There are also significant assumptions that currently have to be made
about the software installed on the already deployed servers.
Effectively, they must match the standard TripleO overcloud-full image.

Change-Id: I4ab1531f69c73457653f1cca3fe30cc32a04c129
Co-Authored-By: Steve Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-09-11 21:09:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/51515d3d97fa776f69f05ab529df2ddfbf0be595', 'message': 'Use already Deployed/Installed servers

commit_message:
Use already Deployed/Installed servers

This patch provides a set of templates that enables
tripleo-heat-templates to be used with a set of already deployed,
installed, and running servers. In this method, Nova and Ironic are not
used to deploy any servers.

This approach is attractive for POC deployments where dedicated
provisioning networks are not available, or other server install methods
are dictated for various reasons.

There are also assumptions that currently have to be made about the software
installed on the already deployed servers.  Effectively, they must match the
standard TripleO overcloud-full image.

Co-Authored-By: Steve Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I4ab1531f69c73457653f1cca3fe30cc32a04c129
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/72/222772/21 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: TripleO with Deployed Servers ============================= The deployed-server set of templates can be used to deploy TripleO via tripleo-heat-templates to servers that are already installed with a base operating system. When OS::TripleO::Server is mapped to the deployed-server.yaml template via the provided deployed-server-environment.yaml resource registry, Nova and Ironic are not used to create any server instances. Heat continues to create the SoftwareDeployment resources, and they are made available to the already deployed and running servers. Deployed Server assumptions --------------------------- It is currently assumed that the deployed servers being used have the required set of software and packages already installed on them. These exact requirements must match how such a server would look if it were deployed the standard way via Ironic using the TripleO overcloud-full image. networking ---------- It's recommended that there be 2 network interfaces on the deployed servers. One should be reserved for remote management and should already be assigned a routable IP address such that ssh or a similar tool be used to connect to the server. The second, or any additional specified, interface will be used and configured by TripleO as it normally would during a standard deployment. The name of this interface is what should be specified for the various os-net-config templates. os-collect-config ----------------- os-collect-config on each deployed server must be manually configured to poll the Heat API for the available SoftwareDeployments. An example configuration for /etc/os-collect-config.conf looks like: [default] command=os-refresh-config [heat] # you can get these values from stackrc on the undercloud user_id=<a user that can connect to heat> # note this must be the ID, not the username password=<a password> auth_url=<keystone url> project_id=<project_id> # note, this must be the ID, not project name stack_id=<stack_id> resource_name=<resource_name> Note that the stack_id value is the id of the nested stack containing the resource (identified by resource_name) implemented by the deployed-server.yaml templates. Once the configuration for os-collect-config has been defined, the service needs to be restarted. Once restarted, it will start polling Heat and applying the SoftwareDeployments.

commit_message:
Rely on namespaced vars for rabbitmq

The namespaced vars already exist and should be used.

Further, doing so provides additional deployment flexibility
so that we may support multi-RabbitMQ cluster environments.

Change-Id: I3a481f523beea3029b392be88199b07d932edef0

commit_message:
Add a doc about appending kernel parameters to boot instances

Close-Bug: #1569189
Change-Id: I3395e635a5c4f45e00ee809dceb63c1755b9e66a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/48/320848/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ` How to append kernel parameters to boot instances ================================================= It is useful to append kernel parameters to instances in order to meet user requirements. Ironic can also let users change the parameters manually once they obtain the nodes but this is not user friendly. PXE boot -------- Currently, ironic support assign an unify kernel parameters to pxe boot instances by modify [pxe]/pxe_append_params or directly change the pxe_config.template. Local boot ---------- For localboot instances, users can make use of configdrive with cloud-init to pass an userdata script to append kernel paramters when create an instance. This is more flexible and can vary per instance. Here is an example for _`grub2 with ubuntu`, users can customize it depends on own demands. About how to enable configdrive see more details in `Enabling the configuration drive (configdrive)`_ .. _`grub2 with ubuntu`: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ironic-boot-kernel-parameters

commit_message:
Apply ResourceGroup blacklist at create time

Because of the requirement that the nested stack exist, the blacklist was
previously ignored at the time the ResourceGroup was created and only
applied on subsequent updates.

Change-Id: I43dbb13e12fad349a226cffe5d0e96ed7fce3aeb
Closes-Bug: #1585206

commit_message:
Tweak AppArmor profile

After some testing with aa-complain it was discovered that
one of the apparmor rules was causing aa-complain to fail.
This patch also fixes an indentation typo.

Change-Id: I7a0e7e64f236136cd0f15fed22233cea533cad0c

subject: Create auto allocated networks in disabled state
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-13 13:38:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/87d394ffca6f65ca14182eea29a7ec40efb12ac8', 'message': 'Make UUID for auto allocated network predictable

Under particular circumstances, multiple requests to the
auto-allocated-topology extension may lead to the transient
creation of duplicated resources. This is dealt with by the
service plugin code, which cleans them up once the condition
is detected. However the client may accidentally be impacted
and potentially left in error (recoverable on retry).

In order to mitigate this even further, the logic to
provision the network for any given tenant is tweaked
slightly so that the network UUID associated to the auto
topology is actually generated based on the tenant ID.

Closes-bug: #1591766

Change-Id: Ia6ff5ad975673875216eb470080dfc0dcf6b9ab2

auto-allocated-topology extension may lead to the transient
creation of duplicated resources. This is dealt with by the
service plugin code, which cleans them up once the condition
is detected. However the client may accidentally be impacted

provision the network for any given tenant is tweaked
slightly so that the network UUID associated to the auto

commit_message:
Create auto allocated networks in disabled state

Under particular circumstances, multiple requests to the
auto-allocated-topology extension may lead to the transient
creation of duplicated resources. This is dealt with by the
service plugin code, which cleans them up once the condition
is detected. However the client may accidentally be impacted
and potentially left in error (recoverable on retry).

In order to address this error condition, the logic to
provision the network for any given tenant is tweaked
slightly so that the network is created in disabled state
and re-enabled when it is safe to do so. A Neutron client
should check the network status to see if the network is
ready for use before getting its hands on it.

Closes-bug: #1591766

Change-Id: Ia6ff5ad975673875216eb470080dfc0dcf6b9ab2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/06/329006/16 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from oslo_db import exception as db_exc def test_get_auto_allocated_topology_duplicated_networks(self): with mock.patch.object( self.mixin, '_get_default_external_network'),\ mock.patch.object( self.mixin, '_provision_tenant_private_network') as f: f.side_effect = db_exc.DBDuplicateEntry response = self.mixin.get_auto_allocated_topology( self.ctx, '91d6a5e771b346a89b85703bcfc6641f', fields=[]) self.assertEqual( '91d6a5e7-71b3-46a8-9b85-703bcfc6641f', response['id']) def test__get_auto_network_uuid(self): tenant_id = '91d6a5e771b346a89b85703bcfc6641f' network_id = '91d6a5e7-71b3-46a8-9b85-703bcfc6641f' self.assertEqual(network_id, self.mixin._get_auto_network_uuid(tenant_id))

commit_message:
Upload images to cache at end of ovb job

Change-Id: Ie443926d9f684038e8f629051f0712230ac6c595
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci refs/changes/62/338762/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # If we got this far and its a periodic job, declare success and upload build artifacts if [ $CACHEUPLOAD == 1 ] ; then # Get the IPA and overcloud images for caching tar -C ~ -cf - ironic-python-agent.initramfs ironic-python-agent.vmlinuz ironic-python-agent.kernel > ipa_images.tar tar -C ~ -cf - overcloud-full.qcow2 overcloud-full.initrd overcloud-full.vmlinuz > overcloud-full.tar md5sum overcloud-full.tar > overcloud-full.tar.md5 md5sum ipa_images.tar > ipa_images.tar.md5 curl http://$MIRRORSERVER/cgi-bin/upload.cgi -F "repohash=$TRUNKREPOUSED" -F "upload=@ipa_images.tar;filename=ipa_images.tar" curl http://$MIRRORSERVER/cgi-bin/upload.cgi -F "repohash=$TRUNKREPOUSED" -F "upload=@overcloud-full.tar;filename=overcloud-full.tar" # TODO(pabelanger): Remove qcow2 format, since centos-7 cannot mount nbd with the default kernel. curl http://$MIRRORSERVER/cgi-bin/upload.cgi -F "repohash=$TRUNKREPOUSED" -F "upload=@ipa_images.tar.md5;filename=ipa_images.tar.md5" curl http://$MIRRORSERVER/cgi-bin/upload.cgi -F "repohash=$TRUNKREPOUSED" -F "upload=@overcloud-full.tar.md5;filename=overcloud-full.tar.md5" curl http://$MIRRORSERVER/cgi-bin/upload.cgi -F "repohash=$TRUNKREPOUSED" -F "$JOB_NAME=SUCCESS" fi

commit_message:
Cleanup/standardize usage of tags

The numerous tags within the role have been condensed
to two tags: aodh-install and aodh-config

These tags have been chosen as they are namespaced
and cover the two major functions of the role.

Documentation has been updated to inform how each tag
influences the function of the role.

Change-Id: I0547471069287310fe7370a574375a5f4d7e73d7

commit_message:
Cleanup/standardize usage of tags

The numerous tags within the role have been condensed
to two tags: barbican-install and barbican-config

These tags have been chosen as they are namespaced
and cover the two major functions of the role.

Documentation has been updated to inform how each tag
influences the function of the role.

Change-Id: I6b7f1377696629d9cc3fff1e56f2751f2badfda8

commit_message:
Added a warning message if environment name is empty

Adding required=False to the environment name form allows it to call
update_cell when it has been left empty. Added logic to update_cell
to check if the form is empty or contains only whitespace and issue a
warning if true and only if the form in question is called 'name'.

Change-Id: I60eb475574be7713807fd0f5548a64b1f8c890c7
Closes-Bug: #1571663
(cherry picked from commit d5f9bce3f3ed5653132d13ecba517fd2a0540f6b)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/murano-dashboard refs/changes/56/335256/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if not new_cell_value or new_cell_value.isspace(): message = _("The environment name field cannot be empty.") messages.warning(request, message) raise ValueError(message) form_field=forms.CharField(required=False),
deleted_lines: form_field=forms.CharField(),

commit_message:
Fix Downloading Package blocks downloading next package

Fix Downloading Package blocks downloading next package,
Use 'tables.LinkAction' instead of 'tables.Action' for
DownloadPackage table action.

Change-Id: I6ca3c628e518cf6e381904f97dd13a1602ba26b9
Closes-Bug: #1579220
(cherry picked from commit 43653f3e5030d9fa98ddf894ef0cf8e4b8796e88)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/murano-dashboard refs/changes/54/335254/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def download_packge(request, app_name, app_id): try: body = api.muranoclient(request).packages.download(app_id) content_type = 'application/octet-stream' response = http.HttpResponse(body, content_type=content_type) response['Content-Disposition'] = 'filename={name}.zip'.format( name=app_name) return response except exc.HTTPException: LOG.exception(_('Something went wrong during package downloading')) redirect = reverse('horizon:murano:packages:index') exceptions.handle(request, _('Unable to download package.'), redirect=redirect)

commit_message:
Add timeout_msg values in fuelweb_test and system_test

- added waiters for node status
- removed redundant try/except/assert

Related blueprint: fuel-qa-failure-reason-grouping
Change-Id: I06ccac42856712d1f9afe64402d34aeba3c07af6

commit_message:
Send a refresh event to all db sync commands

If the "undercloud install" is being run a second time to update/upgrade
an undercloud we will want to ensure all the databases migrated. We need to
explicitly send a refresh event to the sync commands because the packages
are being updated outside of the "puppet apply" and without it puppet doesn't
know its needed.

Change-Id: I1750e09de73aec3a5a0fe181808231ab68e25f69

commit_message:
refactor image functional tests

following the pattern established in commit
09b783ad3e5051564bf6321feace3b65739febbf, create a common
module that sets the API version we plan to use for the
tests.

commit_message:
Fix wrong numa_topology calls

Cluster upgrade from version < 9.0 works with
cluster and nodes meta as it 9.0, however, some
properties may be missed. Thus, some calls of
numa_topology have been changed.

Change-Id: Icb8442102a148a66c2194263432e664614106001
Partial-Bug: #1594443
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web refs/changes/77/338177/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if 'numa_topology' not in node.meta: raise errors.InvalidData( "Seems old nailgun-agent is used. Node '{0}' doesn't" " contain information about NUMA topology." .format(node.id) )

commit_message:
Improve __init__ detection

__init__ method was not detected for Python classes registered into MuranoPL
(for example, for Python MuranoPL plugins) in it was inherited rather than
implemented in the class.

Closes Bug: #1597457

Change-Id: I6f3ae0f6786f807de556f09906856153559efa97
(cherry picked from commit 345117b533ba74a39948ab2df5a54620a71fff0a)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/murano refs/changes/15/338915/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: try: except AttributeError: # __init__ is a slot wrapper inherited from object or other C type
deleted_lines: if '__init__' in cls.__dict__: else:

subject: Implement API call and RPC call for static actions
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-01 16:32:27.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/murano/commit/5b824e920d3b8640624a3a70c53cf956b9aff969', 'message': '[WiP] Implement API call and RPC call for static actions

Static public methods can be called synchronously through the
API call without creating environment, object instances and
database records. It is proposed to make RPC call as the single
request-responce for now because async call without database
persistence requires implementing new way of API-engine
communication for this task.
However async API and RPC calls should also be implemented later
exploiting the same pattern as for calling instance methods.
New call can be done through client method (see
Ib6a60f8e33c5d3593a55db9f758e94e27f0a4445)

TBD:
* proper unsuccessful responces
* tests
* documentation update
* REST API spec update
* release note

APIImpact
Implements: blueprint static-actions
Change-Id: I17ab2eba0fd6c42309667f42d0644d21940ab02d

commit_message:
Implement API call and RPC call for static actions

Static public methods can be called synchronously through the
API call without creating environment, object instances and
database records. It is proposed to make RPC call as the single
request-responce for now.
However async API and RPC calls may also be implemented later
exploiting the same pattern as for calling instance methods.
New call can be done through client method (see
Ib6a60f8e33c5d3593a55db9f758e94e27f0a4445)
Tempest and unit tests are added.

APIImpact
Implements: blueprint static-actions
Change-Id: I17ab2eba0fd6c42309667f42d0644d21940ab02d

commit_message:
Only run kill if there is a httpserver to kill

This kill only exists so that we can rerun toci_* scripts
multiple times, in ci there is nothing to kill and it just
outputs an error message, this change it just to remove
the error message.

Change-Id: I6f0ff4a5a234ec2b42ebb773a010e0fea76298ed

commit_message:
Rework Murano memcache_servers parameter

Upstream patch https://review.openstack.org/336261 was merged, so
now we can rework memcache_servers parameter to using upstream
murano puppets.

commit_message:
Add exception for communicate with glare api

Murano dashboard crashes if glare is down. It should
act similarly as the situations when murano-api is
down, show horizon's error message that it was
impossible to communicate with glare api.

Change-Id: I29687d45d4b6da6ef27bf09bee537efec3bacdeb
Closes-Bug: #1595494
(cherry picked from commit 1c18762ba1c88e08da6e96ae78aed116cd6dab3b)

commit_message:
Use keystoneauth1 lib for authentication helpers

If auth_type is set in the keystone_authtoken section,
then one can use the the keystoneauth1 library to load the
authentication plugin. This makes muranoclient fully workable,
with Keystone v3 in case domain name is not 'Default'.

Related-Bug: 1580611

Change-Id: I0d71032fb5296752ee25482b75993072884731e7

added_lines: from keystoneauth1 import loading as ka_loadingCFG_KEYSTONE_GROUP = 'keystone_authtoken' cfg.CONF.import_group(CFG_KEYSTONE_GROUP, 'keystonemiddleware.auth_token')def _create_keystone_admin_client(): password_auth = ka_loading.load_auth_from_conf_options( cfg.CONF, CFG_KEYSTONE_GROUP) session = _get_session( auth=password_auth, conf_section=cfg.CONF[CFG_KEYSTONE_GROUP]) # Remove project_name and project_id, since we need a trust scoped # auth object kwargs = {'project_name': None, 'project_id': None, 'trust_id': trust_id} password_auth = ka_loading.load_auth_from_conf_options( cfg.CONF, CFG_KEYSTONE_GROUP, **kwargs) session = _get_session(auth=password_auth, conf_section=conf) auth_url = cfg.CONF[CFG_KEYSTONE_GROUP].auth_uri.replace('v2.0', 'v3') session = _get_session(auth=token_auth, conf_section=conf) admin_client = _create_keystone_admin_client() user_client = _create_keystone_admin_client()def _get_session(auth, conf_section): # Fallback to keystone_authtoken section for TLS parameters if not conf_section: conf_section = cfg.CONF[CFG_KEYSTONE_GROUP] session = ka_loading.session.Session().load_from_options( auth=auth, insecure=_get_config_option(conf_section, 'insecure', False), cacert=_get_config_option( conf_section, ('ca_file', 'cafile', 'cacert')), key=_get_config_option(conf_section, ('key_file', 'keyfile')), cert=_get_config_option(conf_section, ('cert_file', 'certfile'))) return session
deleted_lines: from keystoneclient import session as ks_sessionfrom oslo_utils import importutils@helpers.memoize def _get_keystone_admin_parameters(scoped): importutils.import_module('keystonemiddleware.auth_token') settings = { 'auth_url': cfg.CONF.keystone_authtoken.auth_uri.replace('v2.0', 'v3'), 'username': cfg.CONF.keystone_authtoken.admin_user, 'password': cfg.CONF.keystone_authtoken.admin_password, 'user_domain_name': "Default" } if scoped: settings.update({ 'project_name': cfg.CONF.keystone_authtoken.admin_tenant_name, 'project_domain_name': "Default" }) return settingsdef create_keystone_admin_client(scoped): kwargs = _get_keystone_admin_parameters(scoped) password_auth = identity.Password(**kwargs) session = ks_session.Session(auth=password_auth) _set_ssl_parameters(cfg.CONF.keystone_authtoken, session) kwargs = _get_keystone_admin_parameters(False) kwargs['trust_id'] = trust_id password_auth = identity.Password(**kwargs) session = ks_session.Session(auth=password_auth) _set_ssl_parameters(conf, session) auth_url = _get_keystone_admin_parameters(False)['auth_url'] session = ks_session.Session(auth=token_auth) _set_ssl_parameters(conf, session) admin_client = create_keystone_admin_client(True) user_client = create_keystone_admin_client(True)def _set_ssl_parameters(conf_section, session): if not conf_section: return insecure = _get_config_option(conf_section, 'insecure', False) if insecure: session.verify = False else: session.verify = _get_config_option( conf_section, ('ca_file', 'cafile', 'cacert')) or True cert_file = _get_config_option(conf_section, ('cert_file', 'certfile')) key_file = _get_config_option(conf_section, ('key_file', 'keyfile')) if cert_file and key_file: session.cert = (cert_file, key_file) elif cert_file: session.cert = cert_file else: session.cert = None

commit_message:
Bad goal and strategy name for Airflow Optimization

The goal name 'airflow optimization' must be synched with the
entry point name.
The strategy name 'uniform airflow' must be synched with the
entry point name.

Partial-Bug: #1602262

Change-Id: Ibc6f0a7c5047e57549910818200c323b878152b0

commit_message:
Update sphinx configuration

This patch updates the sphinx configuration for docs and releasenotes
to make it easier to replicate across repositories and to comply with
pep8 testing without exceptions.

Change-Id: I428a78d781a35e43d53bbcdaeb94658b5e0c91a7

commit_message:
Introduce Link control to switch to react-routers in future

React-router uses its own Link control to navigate between routes.
This patchset introduces custom Link control that emulates
behavior of an anchor with links modification logic.

Implements blueprint react-router
Change-Id: I40219fd133ed5b0e2cbe98355be4ae6aa78cbe35

commit_message:
Don't catch DBDuplicate in default SG creation

The API now catches duplicate entries directly[1] so there is no
need to convert them into RetryRequests in the security groups code.
1. I828f529db8c389ba0ab1eaa5f93ca2f5563048a8

Change-Id: I4cc5246b8588f847011f6ff75f5f6196d455b20e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/86/338586/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: security_group = { 'security_group': {'name': 'default', 'tenant_id': tenant_id, 'description': _('Default security group')} } return self.create_security_group( context, security_group, default_sg=True)['id']
deleted_lines: return self._create_default_security_group(context, tenant_id) def _create_default_security_group(self, context, tenant_id): security_group = { 'security_group': {'name': 'default', 'tenant_id': tenant_id, 'description': _('Default security group')} } try: security_group = self.create_security_group( context, security_group, default_sg=True) return security_group['id'] except db_exc.DBDuplicateEntry as ex: # default security group was created concurrently LOG.debug("Duplicate default security group %s was " "not created", ex.value) # raise a retry request to restart the whole process since # we could be in a REPEATABLE READ isolation level and won't # be able to see the SG group in this transaction. raise db_exc.RetryRequest(ex)

added_lines: # Copyright 2016 - Nokia # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from vitrage.common.constants import VertexProperties as VProps from vitrage.evaluator.actions.recipes.action_steps import UPDATE_VERTEX from vitrage.evaluator.actions.recipes import base from vitrage.evaluator.actions.recipes.base import ActionStepWrapper from vitrage.evaluator.template_fields import TemplateFields as TFields class MarkDown(base.Recipe): """Mark A host as down. The 'get_do_recipe' and 'get_undo_recipe' receive action_spec as input. The action_spec contains the following fields: type, targets and properties. example input: action_spec = ActionSpecs('type'= {'set_state'}, 'targets'= {target: Vertex}, 'properties' = {is_marked_down : True} """ @staticmethod def get_do_recipe(action_spec): update_vertex_step = MarkDown._get_update_vertex_step( action_spec.targets[TFields.TARGET].vertex_id, True) return [update_vertex_step] @staticmethod def get_undo_recipe(action_spec): update_vertex_step = MarkDown._get_update_vertex_step( action_spec.targets[TFields.TARGET].vertex_id, None) return [update_vertex_step] @staticmethod def _get_update_vertex_step(target_id, is_marked_down): update_vertex_params = { VProps.VITRAGE_ID: target_id, VProps.IS_MARKED_DOWN: is_marked_down } update_vertex_step = ActionStepWrapper(UPDATE_VERTEX, update_vertex_params) return update_vertex_step

commit_message:
Fixed unit tests running on Windows

Replaced all slashes in the paths with os.path.join,
so that they are compatible with Windows and Linux.

commit_message:
Fix Edit Snapshot action

After submitting new values for a snapshot name and description
you get a success message, but the snapshot doesn't change at all.
This patch makes share_snapshot_update call work properly.

Change-Id: I986ea9fea94278b603c6b2bb2f6c8174895692f7
Closes-Bug: #1597241

commit_message:
Add options for configuring file limits in swift

Options have been added to allow a deployer to control the
hard, soft, and fs.file-max limits on swift specific nodes.

Change-Id: Ia5dd51fa360745a9776d58d0bf49d8e1201d3139
Closes-Bug: #1595290
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

subject: Create ceph python library symlinks
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-08 15:41:03.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/os-nova-install.yml', 'playbooks/roles/ceph_client/tasks/ceph_install_python_libs.yml', 'playbooks/os-cinder-install.yml', 'playbooks/roles/ceph_client/tasks/ceph_all.yml', 'playbooks/os-glance-install.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/45b9b2e241f062098d3fbd47ccf9e3a6d6254070', 'message': "Create ceph python library symlinks

Currently, os_nova, os_cinder, and os_glance roles all install
python-cephlibs, which is a python package Hugh Saunders created for
Ceph Hammer python libraries.  The virtualenvs created in these roles
need access to these python libraries and by using Hugh's python
package we could simply pip install into the virtualenv.

This has been working fine, but makes the assumption that the deployer
is using Ceph Hammer, which may not be true.  Also, later versions of
Ceph have python C extensions, which may be more difficult to package.

This commit simply leverages the existing Ceph libraries installed
outside of the venv by checking for the path of the library using
python itself.

NOTE: I would prefer to use a None instead of '' in the ternaries,
but seem to hit issues doing that.

Combined backport of:
- https://review.openstack.org/#/c/317901/
- https://review.openstack.org/#/c/339619/

Change-Id: Ib26c84f6671523b40e61f043713db58d8a756dc9
"}]
commit_message:
Create ceph python library symlinks

Currently, os_nova, os_cinder, and os_glance roles all install
python-cephlibs, which is a python package Hugh Saunders created for
Ceph Hammer python libraries.  The virtualenvs created in these roles
need access to these python libraries and by using Hugh's python
package we could simply pip install into the virtualenv.

This has been working fine, but makes the assumption that the deployer
is using Ceph Hammer, which may not be true.  Also, later versions of
Ceph have python C extensions, which may be more difficult to package.

This commit simply leverages the existing Ceph libraries installed
outside of the venv by checking for the path of the library using
python itself.

NOTE: I would prefer to use a None instead of '' in the ternaries,
but seem to hit issues doing that.

Combined backport of:
- https://review.openstack.org/#/c/317901/
- https://review.openstack.org/#/c/339619/

Change-Id: Ib26c84f6671523b40e61f043713db58d8a756dc9

commit_message:
Fix logger issue in move_files_to_their_places function

A typo in manager.py was fixed. This typo doesn't break
anything when old enough oslo.log module is used, but it
breaks deployment process when newer OS is used to build
bootstrap image.

A minor issue with path build process was also fixed.

Change-Id: I97616ef0bfbe0f7ffc6e625e4bf7c7ffde1a1919
Closes-Bug: #1597697

commit_message:
Extend 'no_cluster_test' with deployment of cluster

For ensuring that Fuel master is still able to deploy clusters
we should... deploy a cluster!

Change-Id: I39445fac011e941ec8c3a619ac03003ffaee1557
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-qa refs/changes/18/339018/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class UpgradeNoCluster(DataDrivenUpgradeBase): @test(groups=['upgrade_no_cluster_deploy'], depends_on=[upgrade_no_cluster_restore]) @log_snapshot_after_test def upgrade_no_cluster_deploy(self): """Deploy fresh cluster using restored empty Fuel Scenario: 1. Revert "upgrade_no_cluster_restore" snapshot 2. Bootstrap 2 additional nodes 3. Create cluster, add 1 controller and 1 compute nodes 4. Verify networks 5. Deploy cluster 6. Verify networks 7. Run OSTF """ self.show_step(1) self.env.revert_snapshot(self.snapshot_name) self.show_step(2) self.env.bootstrap_nodes(self.env.d_env.nodes().slaves[:3]) self.show_step(3) cluster_id = self.fuel_web.create_cluster( name=self.upgrade_no_cluster_deploy.__name__, mode=settings.DEPLOYMENT_MODE, settings={ 'net_provider': settings.NEUTRON, 'net_segment_type': settings.NEUTRON_SEGMENT['vlan'] } ) self.fuel_web.update_nodes( cluster_id, { 'slave-01': ['controller'], 'slave-02': ['compute', 'cinder'] } ) self.show_step(4) self.fuel_web.verify_network(cluster_id) self.show_step(5) self.fuel_web.deploy_cluster_wait(cluster_id) self.show_step(6) self.fuel_web.verify_network(cluster_id) self.show_step(7) self.fuel_web.run_ostf(cluster_id)
deleted_lines: class UpgradePluginNoCluster(DataDrivenUpgradeBase):

commit_message:
Extend 'no_cluster_test' with deployment of cluster

For ensuring that Fuel master is still able to deploy clusters
we should... deploy a cluster!

Change-Id: I39445fac011e941ec8c3a619ac03003ffaee1557
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-qa refs/changes/17/339017/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class UpgradeNoCluster(DataDrivenUpgradeBase): @test(groups=['upgrade_no_cluster_deploy'], depends_on=[upgrade_no_cluster_restore]) @log_snapshot_after_test def upgrade_no_cluster_deploy(self): """Deploy fresh cluster using restored empty Fuel Scenario: 1. Revert "upgrade_no_cluster_restore" snapshot 2. Bootstrap 2 additional nodes 3. Create cluster, add 1 controller and 1 compute nodes 4. Verify networks 5. Deploy cluster 6. Verify networks 7. Run OSTF """ self.show_step(1) self.env.revert_snapshot(self.snapshot_name) self.show_step(2) self.env.bootstrap_nodes(self.env.d_env.nodes().slaves[:3]) self.show_step(3) cluster_id = self.fuel_web.create_cluster( name=self.upgrade_no_cluster_deploy.__name__, mode=settings.DEPLOYMENT_MODE, settings={ 'net_provider': settings.NEUTRON, 'net_segment_type': settings.NEUTRON_SEGMENT['vlan'] } ) self.fuel_web.update_nodes( cluster_id, { 'slave-01': ['controller'], 'slave-02': ['compute', 'cinder'] } ) self.show_step(4) self.fuel_web.verify_network(cluster_id) self.show_step(5) self.fuel_web.deploy_cluster_wait(cluster_id) self.show_step(6) self.fuel_web.verify_network(cluster_id) self.show_step(7) self.fuel_web.run_ostf(cluster_id)
deleted_lines: class UpgradePluginNoCluster(DataDrivenUpgradeBase):

commit_message:
Use venv for all tempest commands

According to last changes the username of script runner is not
stack user, so change the permissions to general $USER,
openstack-tempest is not installed in some jobs, so use venv
for all tempest tools

Change-Id: I1ec0471940034cdc4128a2e5dd188aef369c0629

commit_message:
[cli-ref] concatenate the command options appropriately

Don't break the line between the command option with hyphen.
The hyphen brings a line break to wrap the help within screen
width, which become an unneccesary white space at the docs.
An unneccesary white space within the command option
make the command unusable. To address the problem,
this patch concatenate the command options appropriately.

Change-Id: Iea68a0f5ff96aeedc07b1527aa8ad9ce62734eae
Related-Bug: #1599066

commit_message:
Add Python 3.5 classifier and venv

Now that there is a passing gate job, we can claim support for
Python 3.5 in the classifier. This patch also adds the convenience
py35 venv.

Change-Id: I8871f4e17ab806c00661d0c960a216d0a3fc5449
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.messaging refs/changes/73/340773/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Update Share Snapshot modal form refactoring

This patch removes some redundant code from _update.html template,
adds missing update.html template, fixes cancel button and changes
success url to snapshots tab.

Change-Id: Ief4a6a7d8168c0307d3408df5e96bf91b378c879
Partially-Implements: blueprint form-templates

commit_message:
Set a min and max on the connection_debug option

There is a set allowable minimum and maximum to the connection_debug
option of 0 and 100. The config option should enforce this.

Change-Id: Ica610ad8fc0875a8be1042f7daba5d0a0c1aad03

commit_message:
Add multipathing support to docker container

Due some cinder drivers need multipathing support like this one
http://docs.openstack.org/mitaka/config-reference/block-storage/drivers/ibm-storwize-svc-driver.html

This PS will allow to run these additional drivers when using Kolla.

Implements: blueprint multipath-support
Change-Id: Id6cf29f984c92773bbfc2f95daea573a74701648

subject: Save valid udid on pre_live_migration of vscsi volumes using multi VIOS
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-12 08:09:33.000000000', 'files': ['nova_powervm/tests/virt/powervm/volume/test_vscsi.py', 'nova_powervm/virt/powervm/volume/vscsi.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova-powervm/commit/11985f32a40381d6b14a1475b22990b33dafb71a', 'message': 'Save valid udid on pre_live_migration of vscsi volumes using multi VIOS

The pre_live_migration_on_destination operation for vscsi volumes saved
the udid to be used later during cleanup. In cases where the target
contains multiple VIOS and if one of them do not contain valid ports
then the mig_data will set with udid as None.

Adding code to set the udid only if it is not None.

Change-Id: I3412663a6dab828bbfa2f7fa1c938aa956b7b315
Closes-Bug: 1598393
(cherry picked from commit 9f4b9008861003e3f1185e9cc858c66fab568936)
'}]
commit_message:
Save valid udid on pre_live_migration of vscsi volumes using multi VIOS

The pre_live_migration_on_destination operation for vscsi volumes saved
the udid to be used later during cleanup. In cases where the target
contains multiple VIOS and if one of them do not contain valid ports
then the mig_data will set with udid as None.

Adding code to set the udid only if it is not None.

Change-Id: I3412663a6dab828bbfa2f7fa1c938aa956b7b315
Closes-Bug: 1598393
(cherry picked from commit 9f4b9008861003e3f1185e9cc858c66fab568936)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-powervm refs/changes/66/340766/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # if valid udid is returned save in mig_data volume_key = 'vscsi-' + volume_id if udid is not None: mig_data[volume_key] = udid if not found or volume_key not in mig_data:
deleted_lines: if not found: mig_data['vscsi-' + volume_id] = udid

commit_message:
Add api-version to get server versions

Mitaka Cinder added an API to return Versions from the base
endpoint URL:
http://<url>:8776/
This patch exposes that API for /v3 endpoint microversions 3.0 and
above with the command:
cinder api-version

Implements: blueprint add-get-server-versions

Change-Id: Ieb1a56b28188ec17946fe5564b28c165833ffc24
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-cinderclient refs/changes/27/303627/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from cinderclient import api_versions @utils.service_type('volumev2') @api_versions.wraps("3.0") def do_api_version(cs, args): """Display the API version information.""" columns = ['ID', 'Status', 'Version', 'Min_version'] response = cs.services.server_api_version() utils.print_list(response, columns)

commit_message:
[WIP] Add error handler for store_api and oslo_vo

Change-Id: I5804b5c12afff3588e2037a29c34010a3d3147d2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/82/338182/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from glance_store import exceptions as store_excdef error_handler(f): error_map = { 'BackendException': exception.BadRequest, 'UnsupportedBackend': exception.BadRequest, 'MissingCredentialError': exception.Unauthorized, 'GlanceStoreException': exception.GlareException, 'BadAuthStrategy': exception.Unauthorized, 'AuthorizationRedirect': exception.Unauthorized, 'NotFound': exception.NotFound, 'UnknownScheme': exception.BadRequest, 'BadStoreUri': exception.BadRequest, 'Duplicate': exception.Conflict, 'Conflict': exception.Conflict, 'StorageFull': exception.Forbidden, 'StorageWriteDenied': exception.Forbidden, 'AuthBadRequest': exception.Unauthorized, 'AuthUrlNotFound': exception.Unauthorized, 'AuthorizationFailure': exception.Unauthorized, 'NotAuthenticated': exception.Unauthorized, 'Forbidden': exception.Forbidden, 'Invalid': exception.BadRequest, 'BadStoreConfiguration': exception.BadRequest, 'DriverLoadFailure': exception.BadRequest, 'NoServiceEndpoint': exception.BadRequest, 'RemoteServiceUnavailable': exception.BadRequest, 'HasSnapshot': exception.Conflict, 'InUseByStore': exception.Conflict, } def new_function(*args, **kwargs): try: return f(*args, **kwargs) except (store_exc.GlanceStoreException, store_exc.BackendException) as e: if e.__name__ in error_map: raise error_map[e.__name__](message=e.message) else: raise e return new_function @error_handler

commit_message:
Don't apply config fixture to auth_token.CONF

auth_token.CONF is simply the global oslo.config conf object linked into
the auth_token module. It is not intended for public use and has
recently been moved.

We can mock exactly the same entries without having to reach into
auth_token middleware and should do that instead.

Closes-Bug: #1600529
Change-Id: I5e8a481f37a7b409e491ce893a0e898d5085cc75
(cherry picked from commit 0bd4a6c286c9d867d04f77b17abf4862f3095742)
Conflicts:
	cinder/tests/unit/api/contrib/test_quotas.py
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/21/340521/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.fixture = self.useFixture(config_fixture.Config(CONF))
deleted_lines: from keystonemiddleware import auth_token self.fixture = self.useFixture(config_fixture.Config(auth_token.CONF))

commit_message:
Add support continuously-optimization

This patch set adds support for continuous audit
type and interval field to watcher-dashboard.

Depends-On: I1152c9c6d9379e250ba46adbc58789d8b13bfd5a
Change-Id: Ic05d7c5573413745e0d561b09b4ccc54e015b1cb
Implements: blueprint continuously-optimization
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/watcher-dashboard refs/changes/95/327095/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: audit_type = forms.ChoiceField(label=_("Audit Type"), choices=[(None, _("Select Audit Type")), ('oneshot', _('ONESHOT')), ('continuous', _('CONTINUOUS'))], widget=forms.Select(attrs={ 'class': 'switchable', 'data-slug': 'audit_type' }), required=True) period_continuous = forms.IntegerField(initial=3600, label=_("Period"), help_text=_("Period in seconds for " "CONTINUOUS audit"), widget=forms.TextInput(attrs={ 'class': 'switched', 'data-switch-on': 'audit_type', 'data-audit_type-continuous': _("Period")}), required=True) period_oneshot = forms.IntegerField(initial=0, label=_("Period"), help_text=_("For ONESHOT audit_type" "period is not used"), widget=forms.TextInput(attrs={ 'readonly': 'readonly', 'class': 'switched', 'data-switch-on': 'audit_type', 'data-audit_type-oneshot': _("Period")}), required=True) params['type'] = data['audit_type'].upper() if data['audit_type'] == 'continuous': params['period'] = data['period_continuous'] else: params['period'] = data['period_oneshot']
deleted_lines: params['type'] = 'ONESHOT'

commit_message:
master node keystone under Apache

Fresh keystone packages don't provide
ability to run Keystone under eventlet.
So this migration is done.

Closes-bug: #1601812

Change-Id: Ia469530bf336a3ea2f56d60181e8bee087874298

deleted_lines: service_name => $::fuel::params::keystone_service_name, }

commit_message:
Add a warning to use Fernet as token

Keystone has changed it's default token format to Fernet in
Mitaka. The Keystone bug where this was discussed and addressed is
here: https://bugs.launchpad.net/keystone/+bug/1561054

Change-Id: I75b3d641a08dd7ff6b3c096f5b945f46cec9918f
closes-bug:#1598112
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-keystone refs/changes/73/338073/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Defaults to 'Fernet' $token_provider = 'fernet',
deleted_lines: # Defaults to 'uuid' $token_provider = 'uuid',

commit_message:
Unit test for Create Share Type

This patch adds missing unit test for previously changed
Create Share Type modal.

Change-Id: If7e5f9a2906156ca15839a516d49771dbbcf3106
Partially-Implements: blueprint form-templates
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila-ui refs/changes/64/338864/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_create_share_type(self): url = reverse('horizon:admin:shares:create_type') data = { 'is_public': True, 'name': 'my_share_type', 'spec_driver_handles_share_servers': 'False' } form_data = data.copy() form_data['spec_driver_handles_share_servers'] = 'false' self.mock_object(api_manila, "share_type_create") res = self.client.post(url, data) api_manila.share_type_create.assert_called_once_with( mock.ANY, form_data['name'], form_data['spec_driver_handles_share_servers'], is_public=form_data['is_public']) self.assertRedirectsNoFollow(res, INDEX_URL)

commit_message:
Remove # from buttons initiated routes

Preparation to migration to react-router. # are removed from
app.navigate parameters and substituted inside the method' body.
React-router does not need hashes in the links so they'll be
removed later.

Implements blueprint react-router

commit_message:
Changing filesystems structure.

Separating number of directories:
/home
/var/log/audit
/var
/tmp
into standalone filesystems for security reason.

Closes-Bug: #1526329
Change-Id: I614d79e83420d496daa647bd3cdefc6aab7bdebf

commit_message:
Convert dynamic UI form names to string type

In case form name is in unicode in python2 or bytes in python3,
we need to convert it to str to make form creation possible.

Change-Id: I9ddf4928db9ecf0242f0503888bba56a2a0fdf56
Closes-bug: #1596177

commit_message:
Add $clean_source = 0; in sbuildrc

We don't want to clean the build tree before building, because
that requires some build-dependencies which we may not have
installed.

The $clean_source option is present only in newer versions of
sbuild, so we also need to install the latest jessie-backports
version os sbuild, which this patch also does.

Also fix unix rights for ${BUILDER_HOMEDIR}/.gnupg before
generating keys, and install haveged to make sure we have enough
entropy to generate GPG keys and such.

Change-Id: Ie478e97ea0a5a9a908ecc915bf1333de87fb2ce1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/deb-openstack-pkg-tools refs/changes/14/336714/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # We don't want to run clean of source tree before # entering the chroot, because that would mean we need # some of the build dependencies. \$clean_source = 0;

commit_message:
Horizon django cache compress on ubuntu

Change splits the exec for the manage.py to be split into collectstatic
and compress. Previously, both actions were only executed on redhat but
ubuntu requires compress on config change too.

Change-Id: Ib7238f9bc107c372759d1ebbeb88469806267769
Closes-Bug: #1599536

commit_message:
Prints  '-' instead of 'None' when data is None

Client prints 'None' when data is None , and client also prints
'None' when data is a string 'None'. But string 'None' is  different
to None. To clear the confusion, Client should print '-' instead of
'None' when data is None. Nova Client and Cinder Client has cleared
the confusion.

Change-Id: Iefbe60e4650ab221f1ceebb8e2964f5a43118e01

added_lines: def test_get_object_item_properties_mixed_case_fields(self): class Fake(object): def __init__(self): self.id = 'test_id' self.name = 'test_name' self.test_user = 'test' fields = ('name', 'id', 'test user') mixed_fields = ('test user', 'ID') item = Fake() actual = utils.get_item_properties(item, fields, mixed_fields) self.assertEqual(('test_name', 'test_id', 'test'), actual) def test_get_object_item_desired_fields_differ_from_item(self): class Fake(object): def __init__(self): self.id = 'test_id_1' self.name = 'test_name' self.test_user = 'test' fields = ('name', 'id', 'test user') item = Fake() actual = utils.get_item_properties(item, fields) self.assertNotEqual(('test_name', 'test_id', 'test'), actual) def test_get_object_item_desired_fields_is_empty(self): class Fake(object): def __init__(self): self.id = 'test_id_1' self.name = 'test_name' self.test_user = 'test' fields = [] item = Fake() actual = utils.get_item_properties(item, fields) self.assertEqual((), actual) def test_get_object_item_desired_fields_is_none(self): class Fake(object): def __init__(self): self.id = 'test_id_1' self.name = None self.test_user = 'test' fields = ('name', 'id', 'test user') item = Fake() actual = utils.get_item_properties(item, fields) self.assertEqual(('-', 'test_id_1', 'test'), actual) def test_get_object_item_with_formatters(self): class Fake(object): def __init__(self): self.id = 'test_id' self.name = 'test_name' self.test_user = 'test' class FakeCallable(object): def __call__(self, *args, **kwargs): return 'pass' fields = ('name', 'id', 'test user', 'is_public') formatters = {'is_public': FakeCallable()} item = Fake() act = utils.get_item_properties(item, fields, formatters=formatters) self.assertEqual(('test_name', 'test_id', 'test', 'pass'), act)

commit_message:
Delete libvirt-bin default network to avoid MASQUERADE rules

libvirt-bin installs a 192.168.122.0/24 default network and creates
MASQUERADE rules for it on boot.  These rules will effect and break
instance traffic including GRE tenant networks.

Check if the network exists and then destroy it with virsh net-destroy
which both immediately removes the MASQUERADE rules and the network so
it is not applied after reboot.

Change-Id: Ia79aea6ef889d1ef58f903f967bea37dc07fd160
Closes-Bug: #1387390

commit_message:
Create an admin context to refresh template files

Its impractical to pass in the current context to
TemplateFiles._refresh, and it will soon be mandatory for all db api
context arguments to be not None. This change creates a short-lived
context just for the refresh.

It will have the same effect as the current behaviour of creating a
new session, since the a new session will be associated with the
context, so there is no danger of returning stale data from the
current session's identity map.

This change also makes the context argument mandatory for any raw
templates operations that might need one.

Change-Id: I156096d736aac4999a3eebe077ed50ef7384ca02

commit_message:
Fix argument order for assertEqual to (expected, observed)

assertEqual expects that the arguments provided to it should be
(expected, observed). If a particluar order is kept as a convention,
then it helps to provide a cleaner message to the developer if Unit
Tests fail. The following patch fixes this issue.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: Ib0c04bbb7054776e8f32bb834252198c29232e74
Closes-Bug: #1259292

deleted_lines: self.assertEqual(hba1["ClassDevice"], "host0") self.assertEqual(hba2["ClassDevice"], "host2")

commit_message:
Add stack files retrieval API

Similar to the recent addition that enables retrieval of the current
environment for a stack, this enables reading the current files map
for a running stack, which is useful if you want to introspect the
current state, and/or deploy another similar stack without necessarily
having the exact command/repo used initially.

APIImpact
Implements: blueprint files-show

Change-Id: I3198b6a7dc06648af24c198d39470f3b0d5d6f11

commit_message:
collector: use an intermediate proxy class for event dispatcher

This makes sure that the base class EventDispatcherBase does not owns
any code itself. This makes external plugin easier to implement as they
don't _have_ to inherit from EventDispatcherBase, they just need to
implement a `record_events(events)' method and that's it.

This will allow Panko to provide the database dispatcher without having
a hard dependency on Ceilometer.

Change-Id: I094aed1e7e081fe1de130d987035a6c9d977d25e

commit_message:
Propage errors in post test hook

If prepare scripts fail, we don't want to run the tests. Add error
option to exit early.

Change-Id: I23a0f51f8252beee7c1cd7a9bdf2002884266a71
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/31/340331/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: set -ex
deleted_lines: set -x

commit_message:
Add optional exceptions regex to avoid to retry.

This is useful when the user (a puppet provider) is expecting a error.
With this it doesn't have to wait for the long retry cycle to have its
error back.  This replace the awkward mechanism in
self.request_without_retry which was dynamically mangling
request_timeout and disabled even legit retry.

Examples of such function are self.fetch_user, self.fetch_project in the
keystone provider.

Change-Id: I589da0100ad3ccf3abf17ac8b26c827793ace484
Related-Bug: 1597357

added_lines: # # @param options [Hash] Other options # @options :no_retry_exception_msgs [Array<Regexp>,Regexp] exception without retries def self.request(service, action, properties, credentials=nil, options={}) no_retry = options[:no_retry_exception_msgs] if no_retry no_retry = [no_retry] unless no_retry.is_a?(Array) no_retry.each do |nr| raise exception if exception.message.match(nr) end end
deleted_lines: def self.request_without_retry(&block) previous_timeout = self.request_timeout rc = nil if block_given? self.request_timeout = 0 rc = yield end ensure self.request_timeout = previous_timeout rc end def self.request(service, action, properties, credentials=nil)

commit_message:
Remove Fedora support from CI scripts

We're now using Centos for CI wont be going back.

Change-Id: Ibb7bf57d7f1c459a6596b0b4c3c6f45cf4452117
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci refs/changes/10/338210/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # TODO(pabelanger): Why is python-requests installed from pip? sudo rm -rf /usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/requestssudo sed -i -e "s|^#baseurl=http://mirror.centos.org/centos/|baseurl=$CENTOS_MIRROR|;/^mirrorlist/d" /etc/yum.repos.d/CentOS-Base.repo sudo pip install gear
deleted_lines: # Need to make sure lsb_release is installed sudo yum -y install redhat-lsb-core LSBRELEASE=`lsb_release -i -s` if [ $LSBRELEASE == 'CentOS' ]; then # TODO(pabelanger): Why is python-requests installed from pip? sudo rm -rf /usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/requests fi# This Fedora Mirror is in the same data center as our CI rack export FEDORA_MIRROR=http://dl.fedoraproject.org/pub/fedora/linux# Set the fedora mirror, this is more reliable then relying on the repolist returned by metalinkif [ $LSBRELEASE == 'Fedora' ]; then sudo sed -i -e "s|^#baseurl=http://download.fedoraproject.org/pub/fedora/linux|baseurl=$FEDORA_MIRROR|;/^metalink/d" /etc/yum.repos.d/fedora*.repo else sudo sed -i -e "s|^#baseurl=http://mirror.centos.org/centos/|baseurl=$CENTOS_MIRROR|;/^mirrorlist/d" /etc/yum.repos.d/CentOS-Base.repo fi if [ $LSBRELEASE == 'CentOS' ]; then sudo pip install gear fi

commit_message:
Adds method for returning DNS Zone properties

Currently, if there is an existing DNS Zone, there
is no way to find information about the zone
which can be useful in some circumstances.

This patch addresses this issue by adding a method
which will return the DNS Zone properties as
a dictionary.

Change-Id: I20bc579e615ee69a1f94677284b30ef69918f45d
Related blueprint: os-win-dnsutils
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-win refs/changes/86/336386/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: If the zone exists, its properties are checked to see if they match the requested ones. zone = self._get_zone(zone_name) if zone is not None: # Zone already exists, check its properties to see if the # existing zone is identical to the requested one zone_masters = zone.MasterServers if zone.MasterServers else [] requested_masters = ip_addrs if ip_addrs else [] masters_match = set(zone_masters) == set(requested_masters) zone_type_match = zone.ZoneType == zone_type ds_integrated_match = zone.DsIntegrated == ds_integrated data_file_match = zone.DataFile == data_file_name identical_zone_exists = (masters_match and zone_type_match and ds_integrated_match and data_file_match) if identical_zone_exists: return zone.path_()
deleted_lines: if self.zone_exists(zone_name):

subject: Not auto schedule router when sync routers from agent
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-21 11:55:31.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/15c54809e8563d29f756a1d861373e0600cb00a7', 'message': "Not auto schedule router when sync routers from agent

Now there are 2 code path that will auto schedule routers to agent.

The first one is get_router_ids, which will bind all un-scheduled
routers to the agent. This will happen at agent startup, revive, and
update.

The second one is sync_routers, which will bind the specified routers
to agent. This will happen when agent requires some router info.

Since 'router_id' will be removed in the dependent patch, get_router_ids
will always be called at agent startup, revive, and update, which can
cover all the cases that auto schedule needs. And no need for other
code path.

In this patch, auto schedule router will be removed from sync_routers,
so that the reported bug can be fixed. And potential race can be avoid
accoridng to [1]

The result of patch will make the l3 agent can't get the router info
when the router is not binded to the l3 agent. And router in agent will
be removed during the agent processing. This makes sense, since, in
neutron server, the router is not tied to the agent. For DVR, if there
are service port in the agent host, the router info will still be
returned to l3 agent.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/317949/

Change-Id: Id0a8cf7537fefd626df06064f915d2de7c1680c6
Co-Authored-By: John Schwarz <jschwarz@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1593653

commit_message:
Not auto schedule router when sync routers from agent

In this patch, auto schedule router will be removed from sync_routers,
so that the reported bug can be fixed. And potential race can be avoid
accoridng to [1]

The result of patch will make the l3 agent can't get the router info
when the router is not bound to the l3 agent. And router in agent will
be removed during the agent processing. This makes sense, since, in
neutron server, the router is not tied to the agent. For DVR, if there
are service port in the agent host, the router info will still be
returned to l3 agent.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/317949/

Change-Id: Id0a8cf7537fefd626df06064f915d2de7c1680c6
Co-Authored-By: John Schwarz <jschwarz@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1593653

commit_message:
Use a shortcut to configure function

Use a shortcut to configure function instead of
a redefined new function.

Change-Id: Ifa20565457b68f0ec2360185c51d7754cd4c241d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rally refs/changes/60/339960/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: def configure(name, namespace="default"): return plugin.configure(name=name, namespace=namespace)

subject: Quick logic fix for MTU
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-01 10:48:11.000000000', 'files': ['fuelweb_test/tests/test_jumbo_frames.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-qa/commit/e276567c47ba7f5d32b81981ba03d2ce87fd3c8b', 'message': 'Quick logic fix for MTU

commit_message:
Quick logic fix for MTU

Since Cirros has no proper ping utility, check that 9001 byte packet
could pass has no sense (ICMP will be fragmented).

Change-Id: I8501d71491ff72a56116198bbb71e6a262f49efb
Partial-Bug: #1572079
(cherry picked from commit 92ae4c8e4ed965af91c57e218ef7ffa7fe95db61)
(cherry picked from commit 62506fde4bc6f66a993ce2a488ff849a6531d4e2)

commit_message:
Bump fuel-devops source requirements to 2.9.21

- requirements-devops-source.txt bumped to 2.9.21 to update
  fuel-devops on CI
- requirements-devops.txt keep >=2.9.20 to let tests run on 2.9.20
  It is just for check the minimal requirements and can be updated
  later, when 2.9.21 will be installed on all CI nodes.

Change-Id: I0e20367079e07daca08eefdceb532fe008d7d7e8
