commit_message:
WIP Add CI summary stats

Change-Id: I2e21f3908f96ff3793de6c4a56555ea2fcf56478
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci refs/changes/12/303612/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # we need a common zuul_ref for each trigger so we can put # results in the same table row, the best we have is the date "c/%s\">%s %s/%s" % (this_gerrit_ref.replace(",", "/"), this_gerrit_ref, project, job.zuul_ref.split("/")[-2]))def compare_jobs(session, job1_name, job2_name, branch, stats_days): refs_done = [] total_job1_success = 0 total_job2_success = 0 total_both_success = 0 total_job1_fail = 0 total_job2_fail = 0 total_trials = 0 start_date = now - datetime.timedelta(days=stats_days) for job in session.query(Job).filter(Job.dt >= start_date).\ order_by(desc(Job.dt)): # puppet and diskimage-builder only run one job # and tripleo-ci changes are excluded since we often use # WIPs to try out CI changes. if ('puppet' in job.zuul_project or 'diskimage' in job.zuul_project or 'tripleo-ci' in job.zuul_project): continue if job.zuul_ref in refs_done: continue if branch not in job.zuul_ref: continue refs_done.append(job.zuul_ref) job1_success = len(session.query(Job). filter(Job.name == job1_name). filter(Job.zuul_ref == job.zuul_ref). filter(Job.status == "SUCCESS"). all()) job2_success = len(session.query(Job). filter(Job.name == job2_name). filter(Job.zuul_ref == job.zuul_ref). filter(Job.status == "SUCCESS"). all()) job1_fail = len(session.query(Job). filter(Job.name == job1_name). filter(Job.zuul_ref == job.zuul_ref). filter(Job.status == "FAILURE"). all()) job2_fail = len(session.query(Job). filter(Job.name == job2_name). filter(Job.zuul_ref == job.zuul_ref). filter(Job.status == "FAILURE"). all()) both_success = job1_success and job2_success both_fail = job1_fail and job2_fail one_fail = (job1_fail and job2_success) or (job1_success and job2_fail) # Throw out any jobs that do not have status in [SUCCESS,FAILURE] # for both jobs being compared. if not (both_success or both_fail or one_fail): continue total_trials += 1 total_job1_success += job1_success total_job2_success += job2_success total_both_success += both_success total_job1_fail += job1_fail total_job2_fail += job2_fail job1_success_rate = total_job1_success / float(total_job1_success + total_job1_fail) job2_success_rate = total_job2_success / float(total_job2_success + total_job2_fail) both_success_rate = total_both_success / float(total_trials) print 'job1:', job1_name print 'job2:', job2_name print 'branch:', branch print 'sample_size:', total_trials print 'job1 and job2 combined success rate:', both_success_rate print 'job1 success rate:', job1_success_rate print 'job2 success rate:', job2_success_rate print 'job1 success rate conditional on job2 success:' if job2_success_rate != 0: print both_success_rate / job2_success_rate else: print 'undefined' print 'job2 success rate conditional on job1 success:' if job1_success_rate != 0: print both_success_rate / job1_success_rate else: print 'undefined' print '---------------------------------------' parser.add_argument('-j', default=",".join(default_job_names), help='comma seperated list of jobs to monitor.') stats_days = 1 print 'report ran:', now print 'reporting on the last', stats_days, 'days' for branch in ['liberty', 'mitaka', 'master']: compare_jobs(session, 'gate-tripleo-ci-f22-upgrades', 'gate-tripleo-ci-f22-nonha', branch, stats_days) compare_jobs(session, 'gate-tripleo-ci-f22-ha', 'gate-tripleo-ci-f22-nonha', branch, stats_days)
deleted_lines: import os # we need a common zuul_ref for each trigger so we can put results in the same # table row, the best we have is the date "c/%s\">%s %s/%s" % (this_gerrit_ref.replace(",", "/"), this_gerrit_ref, project, job.zuul_ref.split("/")[-2])) parser.add_argument('-j', default=",".join(default_job_names), help= 'comma seperated list of jobs to monitor.') gen_html(session, opts.o, "%s-table" % opts.o, 24, job_names)

subject: Refactor Ironic job macro
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-07 16:19:48.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/devstack-gate.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/f7125c8920375c0c2eb351dd3225f019417d8141', 'message': "Refactor Ironic job macro

Ironic is getting more and more jobs to test the different deployment
scenarios we support, every time we add a new optional feature we add a
new conditional to the existing macro to enable it for one job, and then
we have to add a new variable to every job template that uses that
macro.

This is getting unmanageable and messy, so this patch refactors out the
configurations we've been controlling using conditionals into their own
builders which can be pulled into a job-template only if required. It
does this by writing the optional script parts into a file call
ironic-extra-vars which is then sourced in the main ironic macro.

Change-Id: Ic38e24b8a8496ba58ecf13a57df16dc9263867ee
"}]
commit_message:
Refactor Ironic job macro

Ironic is getting more and more jobs to test the different deployment
scenarios we support, every time we add a new optional feature we add a
new conditional to the existing macro to enable it for one job, and then
we have to add a new variable to every job template that uses that
macro.

This is getting unmanageable and messy, so this patch refactors out the
configurations we've been controlling using conditionals into their own
builders which can be pulled into a job-template only if required. It
does this by writing the optional script parts into a file call
ironic-extra-vars which is then sourced in the main ironic macro.

Change-Id: Ic38e24b8a8496ba58ecf13a57df16dc9263867ee
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/11/339111/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

'"IRONIC_DEPLOY_DRIVER_ISCSI_WITH_IPA=True" # Support for non-CoreOS IPA ramdisks was added in Mitaka if [ "$ZUUL_BRANCH" != "stable/kilo" -a "$ZUUL_BRANCH" != "stable/liberty" ] ; then # Standardize VM size for each supported ramdisk case "{ramdisk-type}" in 'tinyipa') export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"IRONIC_VM_SPECS_RAM=384" export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'

commit_message:
Hyper-V: Fixes disk overhead claim issue

For each started VM, Hyper-V creates a VM memory file on the local
disk. The size of the file is the same as the size of the VM's
memory amount.

Implements the mentioned method in HyperVDriver.

(cherry-picked from commit f3ad794bf75ac4b4251bcbbcbdb5ec7791fbea2e)

Change-Id: I51764af539f0a595c81fb3f58ccd8af2d853f5f2
Closes-Bug: #1505681

commit_message:
We shouldn't support cases with separate keystone/db,
due to this fact cases will be deleted.

Change-Id: I65bd70e1aada05ba75c1d240549d23eaec783583
Related-Bug: #1601824

deleted_lines: # Copyright 2015 Mirantis, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import os from proboscis import test from proboscis.asserts import assert_true from fuelweb_test.helpers.checkers import check_plugin_path_env from fuelweb_test.helpers import utils from fuelweb_test.helpers.decorators import log_snapshot_after_test from fuelweb_test import settings from fuelweb_test.tests.base_test_case import SetupEnvironment from fuelweb_test.tests.base_test_case import TestBasic @test(groups=["thread_separate_services_ceph"]) class SeparateKeystoneCeph(TestBasic): """SeparateKeystoneCeph""" # TODO documentation @test(depends_on=[SetupEnvironment.prepare_slaves_9], groups=["separate_keystone_ceph_service"]) @log_snapshot_after_test def separate_keystone_ceph_service(self): """Deployment with separate keystone nodes and ceph for all Scenario: 1. Install database and keystone plugins on the master node 2. Create Ubuntu, Neutron VXLAN, ceph for all storages cluster 3. Change ceph replication factor to 2 4. Add 3 nodes with controller role 5. Add 3 nodes with database+keystone role 6. Add 1 compute node 7. Add 2 ceph nodes 8. Run network verification 9. Deploy changes 10. Run network verification 11. Run OSTF tests Duration 120m Snapshot separate_keystone_ceph_service """ self.check_run("separate_keystone_ceph_service") check_plugin_path_env( var_name='SEPARATE_SERVICE_DB_PLUGIN_PATH', plugin_path=settings.SEPARATE_SERVICE_DB_PLUGIN_PATH ) check_plugin_path_env( var_name='SEPARATE_SERVICE_KEYSTONE_PLUGIN_PATH', plugin_path=settings.SEPARATE_SERVICE_KEYSTONE_PLUGIN_PATH ) self.env.revert_snapshot("ready_with_9_slaves") # copy plugins to the master node utils.upload_tarball( ip=self.ssh_manager.admin_ip, tar_path=settings.SEPARATE_SERVICE_DB_PLUGIN_PATH, tar_target="/var") utils.upload_tarball( ip=self.ssh_manager.admin_ip, tar_path=settings.SEPARATE_SERVICE_KEYSTONE_PLUGIN_PATH, tar_target="/var") # install plugins utils.install_plugin_check_code( ip=self.ssh_manager.admin_ip, plugin=os.path.basename( settings.SEPARATE_SERVICE_DB_PLUGIN_PATH)) utils.install_plugin_check_code( ip=self.ssh_manager.admin_ip, plugin=os.path.basename( settings.SEPARATE_SERVICE_KEYSTONE_PLUGIN_PATH)) data = { 'volumes_lvm': False, 'volumes_ceph': True, 'images_ceph': True, 'ephemeral_ceph': True, 'objects_ceph': True, 'osd_pool_size': '2', 'tenant': 'separatekeystoneceph', 'user': 'separatekeystoneceph', 'password': 'separatekeystoneceph', "net_provider": 'neutron', "net_segment_type": settings.NEUTRON_SEGMENT['tun'], } cluster_id = self.fuel_web.create_cluster( name=self.__class__.__name__, mode=settings.DEPLOYMENT_MODE, settings=data) plugin_names = ['detach-database', 'detach-keystone'] msg = "Plugin couldn't be enabled. Check plugin version. Test aborted" for plugin_name in plugin_names: assert_true( self.fuel_web.check_plugin_exists(cluster_id, plugin_name), msg) options = {'metadata/enabled': True} self.fuel_web.update_plugin_data(cluster_id, plugin_name, options) self.fuel_web.update_nodes( cluster_id, { 'slave-01': ['controller'], 'slave-02': ['controller'], 'slave-03': ['controller'], 'slave-04': ['standalone-database', 'standalone-keystone'], 'slave-05': ['standalone-database', 'standalone-keystone'], 'slave-06': ['standalone-database', 'standalone-keystone'], 'slave-07': ['compute'], 'slave-08': ['ceph-osd'], 'slave-09': ['ceph-osd'] } ) self.fuel_web.verify_network(cluster_id) # Cluster deploy self.fuel_web.deploy_cluster_wait(cluster_id) self.fuel_web.verify_network(cluster_id) self.fuel_web.run_ostf( cluster_id=cluster_id) self.env.make_snapshot("separate_keystone_ceph_service")

commit_message:
Standardise role test implementation

This patch implements the full role testing from the master branch
into the stable/mitaka branch to ensure that patches submitted
against the branch are properly tested.

Change-Id: Ia0959ab670abead77e7104779837ac03cb4930b8

commit_message:
Add group vars to prep for os_tempest role changes

In review [1], we are updating os_tempest to function more like other
openstack-ansible roles.  However, to avoid breaking existing tooling
etc. we want to continue cloning tempest into /opt.  This commit simply
sets two group vars so that when [1] merges the integrated
openstack-ansible gate will continue to pass.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/310766/

Change-Id: Ie700c061cf0efa3d1fcda9e74618bb8c6e9ae371
(cherry picked from commit 60247f25b68fbe2a77e0e10b7fa7014c5bf9691f)

we correct in this commit.

Additionally, this commit adds a functional test to os_tempest role

testing.

commit_message:
Fix breaking typo and add functional test

Review [1] added a breaking typo to tasks/tempest_install.yml, which
we correct in this commit.

Additionally, this commit adds a functional test to os_tempest role
which deploys os_tempest itself and then runs some arbitrary keystone
tempest tests.  Having this test in place will prevent basic issues
like the one introduced in [1] from being commited.

Note that we deploy galera into a container, however we can probably
skip that.  Having it in a container gives us the ability to easily add
in more services if necessary.  The installation of rabbitmq has been
excluded since that should not be necessary in the context of this
testing.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/309034/

Change-Id: I144118b5e70f558554107345088cb36693a85e25
(cherry picked from commit ccc4dc5a51d5450af8c7b2aac9de8f2be714da32)

commit_message:
Add a second proxy-logging middleware entry to swift-proxy

Its absence results in swift using up all the memory available to it when
certain objects are requested, we are not sure exactly what triggers the
problem but we know this fixes it.

Change-Id: Ie4eeaaa83c4e0a181559af639fc13e7fc4939480
Closes-Bug: #1595916

commit_message:
Respect <all-in> type

There was a comment saying "value must be a list" when <all-in> is the
operator. This wasn't enforced and in fact usually a string was
passed. That prevents <all-in> from working as intended, so close this
loophole.

Change-Id: I756903fb42f7655bd5510dafa24094fc67c977b0

commit_message:
Remove tripleo-jobs.py

This script relied on the jenkins API, jenkins
isn't coming back and we have an alternative.

Change-Id: Ic1998a6899eccfa65e463a718d1bb0130b489b69
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci refs/changes/57/337657/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

#!/usr/bin/python import argparse import datetime import os import sys import time from jenkinsapi.jenkins import Jenkins from jenkinsapi.utils.requester import Requester from sqlalchemy import create_engine, Column, Integer, String, DateTime from sqlalchemy.ext.declarative import declarative_base from sqlalchemy.orm import sessionmaker from sqlalchemy import desc colors = {"SUCCESS": "#008800", "FAILURE": "#FF0000", "ABORTED": "#000000"} Base = declarative_base() class Job(Base): __tablename__ = "jobs" id = Column(Integer, primary_key=True) dt = Column(DateTime) name = Column(String) duration = Column(Integer) gerrit_ref = Column(String) log_path = Column(String) zuul_ref = Column(String) zuul_project = Column(String) status = Column(String) url = Column(String) default_job_names = [ 'gate-tripleo-ci-centos-7-nonha', 'gate-tripleo-ci-centos-7-ha', 'gate-tripleo-ci-centos-7-upgrades', 'gate-tripleo-ci-centos-7-containers', 'gate-tripleo-ci-centos-7-ovb-ha', ] now = datetime.datetime.now() def get_data(session, stop_after, job_names): for jenkinsnumber in range(1, 8): jurl = 'https://jenkins%02d.openstack.org' % jenkinsnumber jrequester = Requester(None, None, baseurl=jurl, ssl_verify=False) try: jenkins = Jenkins(jurl, requester=jrequester) except: print "Couldn't connect to %s" % jurl continue for jobname in job_names: try: job = jenkins.get_job(jobname) except: print "Couldn't get job %s(%s)" % (jobname, jurl) continue builds = job.get_build_dict().items() builds.sort() builds.reverse() for buildnumber, buildurl in builds: thisjob = session.query(Job).filter(Job.url == buildurl).all() # these are finised no need to hit jenkins again if thisjob and thisjob[0].status in ["SUCCESS", "FAILURE", "ABORTED"]: continue time.sleep(.3) print "Checking", buildurl try: build = job.get_build(buildnumber) except: print "ERROR ????" gerrit_ref = zuul_ref = zuul_project = log_path = None for param in build.get_actions()['parameters']: if param['name'] == "ZUUL_CHANGE_IDS": gerrit_ref = param["value"].split(" ")[-1] elif param['name'] == "ZUUL_REF": zuul_ref = param["value"] elif param['name'] == "ZUUL_PROJECT": zuul_project = param["value"] elif param['name'] == "LOG_PATH": log_path = param["value"] # These are blank if it was a periodic job # we need a common zuul_ref for each trigger so we can put results in the same # table row, the best we have is the date zuul_ref = zuul_ref or str(build.get_timestamp().date()) gerrit_ref = gerrit_ref or "" if log_path is None: continue if thisjob: print "Updating", buildurl thisjob[0].status = build.get_status() thisjob[0].duration = build.get_duration().seconds continue print "Saving", buildurl session.add(Job(dt=build.get_timestamp(), duration=build.get_duration().seconds, status=build.get_status(), name=jobname, gerrit_ref=gerrit_ref, log_path=log_path, zuul_ref=zuul_ref, zuul_project=zuul_project, url=buildurl)) session.commit() def gen_html(session, html_file, table_file, stats_hours, job_names): refs_done = [] fp = open(table_file, "w") fp.write('') fp.write("") for job_name in job_names: fp.write("" % job_name.replace("gate-tripleo-ironic-", "")) fp.write("") count = 0 for job in session.query(Job).order_by(desc(Job.dt)): if count > 500: break if job.zuul_ref in refs_done: continue refs_done.append(job.zuul_ref) count += 1 job_columns = "" this_gerrit_ref = job.gerrit_ref this_gerrit_num = this_gerrit_ref.split(",")[0] for job_name in job_names: job_columns += "" % (this_gerrit_ref.replace(",", "/"), this_gerrit_ref, project, job.zuul_ref.split("/")[-2])) else: fp.write("") fp.write(job_columns) fp.write("") fp.write("
 %s
" for job in session.query(Job).\ filter(Job.zuul_ref == job.zuul_ref).\ filter(Job.name == job_name).\ order_by(desc(Job.dt)).all(): color = colors.get(job.status, "#666666") job_columns += '' % color job_columns += '%s' % \ (color, job.url, job.dt.strftime("%m-%d %H:%M")) job_columns += ' - %.0f min ' % (job.duration / 60) job_columns += '") else: fp.write("
") project = "" if job.zuul_project: project = job.zuul_project.split("/")[-1] if this_gerrit_ref: fp.write("%s %s/%s
") fp.close() with open(html_file, "w") as f: f.write('') f.write(open(table_file).read()) f.write("
") def main(args=sys.argv[1:]): parser = argparse.ArgumentParser( description=("Get details of tripleo ci jobs and generates a html " "report.")) parser.add_argument('-f', action='store_true', help='Fetch recent data from jenkins servers.') parser.add_argument('-n', type=int, default=3, help='Stop processing downloading from jenkins after ' 'hitting this number of builds already in the ' 'database i.e. assume we already have the rest.') parser.add_argument('-o', default="tripleo-jobs.html", help="html file") parser.add_argument('-d', default="tripleo-jobs.db", help="sqlite file") parser.add_argument('-j', default=",".join(default_job_names), help= 'comma seperated list of jobs to monitor.') opts = parser.parse_args(args) engine = create_engine('sqlite:///%s' % opts.d) Base.metadata.create_all(engine) Session = sessionmaker(bind=engine) session = Session() job_names = opts.j.split(",") if opts.f: get_data(session, opts.n, job_names) gen_html(session, opts.o, "%s-table" % opts.o, 24, job_names) if __name__ == '__main__': exit(main())

commit_message:
Remove policy_engine dependency while starting API

This commit removes the hard dependency of starting API server
along with policy_engine. Its upto deployers choice of enabling the
services on the same node or different nodes.

Supported Options:
Any combination of API , PE, Datasources
Eg:-
python /usr/local/bin/congress-server --api --node_id=api-node
python /usr/local/bin/congress-server --api --policy_engine --node_id=policy-node
python /usr/local/bin/congress-server --datasources --node_id=data-node
python /usr/local/bin/congress-server --api --policy_engine --datasources

Change-Id: Ib0b333e86eff24ea82fea6a60b4688e4666b559b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/congress refs/changes/80/338080/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def create_api_server(conf_path, node_id, host, port, workers, policy_engine, datasources): policy_engine=policy_engine,def launch_api_server(node_id, policy, datasources): LOG.info("Starting congress API server on port %d", cfg.CONF.bind_port) policy_engine=policy,def create_nonapi_server(node_id, policy_engine, datasources, workers): congress_server = eventlet_server.Server(node_id, bus_id=cfg.CONF.bus_id) harness.create2(node=congress_server.node, api=False, policy_engine=policy_engine, datasources=datasources)def launch_servers(node_id, api, policy, data): if api: servers=launch_api_server(node_id, policy, data) else: servers.append(create_nonapi_server(node_id, cfg.CONF.api_workers)) deploy_api = cfg.CONF.api deploy_policy = cfg.CONF.policy_engine if deploy_api or deploy_policy or deploy_datasources: not (deploy_api and deploy_policy and deploy_datasources)): servers = launch_servers(cfg.CONF.node_id, deploy_api, deploy_policy, deploy_datasources)
deleted_lines: def create_api_server(conf_path, node_id, host, port, workers, datasources): policy_engine=True,def launch_api_server(node_id, datasources): LOG.info("Starting congress server on port %d", cfg.CONF.bind_port)def create_nonapi_server(node_id, workers): congress_server = eventlet_server.Server( node_id, bus_id=cfg.CONF.bus_id) harness.create2(node=congress_server.node, api=False, policy_engine=False)def launch_nonapi_server(node_id): # Launch a server comprised of just datasources servers.append(create_nonapi_server(node_id, cfg.CONF.api_workers)) deploy_api_policy = cfg.CONF.api_policy if deploy_api_policy or deploy_datasources: not (deploy_api_policy and deploy_datasources)): if deploy_datasources and not deploy_api_policy: # DS LOG.info("Deploying a Datasource node: %s" % args) servers = launch_nonapi_server(cfg.CONF.node_id) elif deploy_api_policy and not deploy_datasources: # API + PE LOG.info("Deploying a Policy+API node: %s" % args) servers = launch_api_server(cfg.CONF.node_id, datasources=False) else: # PE + API + DS # either both deploy_datasources and deploy_apipolicy are true # or neither was supplied and we deploy everything. node_id = cfg.CONF.node_id or "api-policy-datasource" LOG.info("Deploying a Policy+API+Datasource node %s" % args) servers = launch_api_server(node_id, datasources=True)

commit_message:
Add Python 3.5 classifier and venv

Now that there is a passing gate job, we can claim support for
Python 3.5 in the classifier. This patch also adds the convenience
py35 venv.

Change-Id: I96bd1ee7501905cc6a9cf9299b007dadaeac0d28

commit_message:
Add group vars to prep for os_tempest role changes

In review [1], we are updating os_tempest to function more like other
openstack-ansible roles.  However, to avoid breaking existing tooling
etc. we want to continue cloning tempest into /opt.  This commit simply
sets two group vars so that when [1] merges the integrated
openstack-ansible gate will continue to pass.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/310766/

Change-Id: Ie700c061cf0efa3d1fcda9e74618bb8c6e9ae371
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/20/312520/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: tempest_venv_tag: "{{ tempest_git_install_branch }}"

commit_message:
Address Ansible bare variable usage

When executing the role with Ansible 2.1, the following
deprecation warning is issued in the output for some tasks.

[DEPRECATION WARNING]: Using bare variables is deprecated.

This patch addresses the tasks to fix the behaviour appropriately.

Also removed a single usage of with_items that contained one item
in favor of a simple non-looping task.

Change-Id: Ief1a53bb0804dfdbd742bfe919438d80428287da
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_swift refs/changes/86/329986/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: with_items: swift_account_program_names with_items: swift_container_program_names with_items: swift_object_program_names with_items: swift_proxy_program_names

commit_message:
Update packages from requirements.txt with 'system_tests.sh -N'

Default behaviour of the system_tests.sh is unchanged,
but with -N it will update requirements on each run (without
--upgrade).
If fuel-devops has incorrect version or not installed, then
script will fail with -N option (until fuel-devops is not packed
to PyPi repository).

- Removed dependency on fuel-devops located on github.
  This dependency splitted into two requirements:

  requirements-devops.txt : will be used with -N option to
      controll the installed fuel-devops version;

  requirements-devops-source.txt : will be used for tox tests
      and update python virtual environments on CI.

- Update system_tests.sh with two new options: -R and -N:
  REQUIREMENTS_DIR or -R : name of the dir where requirements.txt
  and constraints.txt are located (fuelweb_test by default)
  UPDATE_REQUIREMENTS or -N : 'yes' or 'no' (-N == 'yes').
  Perform update PyPi packages from requirements.txt.
  Default : 'no'

- remove unused variables and code that was used for build ISO

Change-Id: Ib9efd2136226fb43b506db390079f1b72a06069d
Related-Bug:#1575065
(cherry picked from commit 5a62e85)
(cherry picked from commit 61d0588)

- Update system_tests.sh with two new options: -R and -N:
  REQUIREMENTS_DIR or -R : name of the dir where requirements.txt
  and constraints.txt are located (fuelweb_test by default)
  UPDATE_REQUIREMENTS or -N : 'yes' or 'no' (-N == 'yes').
  Perform update PyPi packages from requirements.txt.
  Default : 'no'

- remove unused variables and code that was used for build ISO

Change-Id: Ib9efd2136226fb43b506db390079f1b72a06069d
Related-Bug:#1575065
(cherry picked from commit 5a62e85)
(cherry picked from commit 61d0588)
(cherry picked from commit 3436ae4)

commit_message:
corrected documentation for registry version

The documentation was saying of installing registry 2.3 but
the tag used is registry:2. This tag gets updated to the recent
versions of registry, and hence, this fix was required.
Closes-Bug: 1598231

Change-Id: I3c37c3564678467402223a48c69a1ae7ccbaeebb

Prior to this change, the nova-compute.log would complain with:

"Config mismatch. The network_api_class specifies
nova.network.neutronv2.api.API, however use_neutron is not set to True. Using
Neutron networking for now, however please set use_neutron to True in your
configuration as network_api_class is deprecated and will be removed."

Closes-Bug: #1600360
Change-Id: I2933565deec42172c9cdc836c5a4b88b44214d07
(cherry picked from commit bf12ab4253eae97475e34fd31acdaffe2b1e84c4)

commit_message:
Replace network_api_class with use_neutron

network_api_class config has been deprecated in favor of
use_neutron

Prior to this change, the nova-compute.log would complain with:

"Config mismatch. The network_api_class specifies
nova.network.neutronv2.api.API, however use_neutron is not set to True. Using
Neutron networking for now, however please set use_neutron to True in your
configuration as network_api_class is deprecated and will be removed."

Closes-Bug: #1600360
Change-Id: I2933565deec42172c9cdc836c5a4b88b44214d07
(cherry picked from commit bf12ab4253eae97475e34fd31acdaffe2b1e84c4)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_nova refs/changes/12/340512/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: use_neutron = True
deleted_lines: network_api_class = nova.network.neutronv2.api.API

commit_message:
Delete reduplicate code in test_compute_mgr.py

build_resources_with_network_info_obj_on_spawn_failure,
test_build_resources_cleans_up_and_reraises_on_spawn_failure.
the content of the cases are exactly the same.
So delete one of them.

Change-Id: Ic4bd314caf2cbe94a7a612637df87b7c7f552bbb

subject: Don't overwrite MarkerNotFound error message
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-11 19:26:12.000000000', 'files': ['nova/objects/flavor.py', 'nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/146876c4c58317a1550bea47343b4aea4eac6f84', 'message': "Don't overwrite MarkerNotFound error message

Several places raising MarkerNotFound were overwriting the
error message with the marker key. This fixes that by passing
the marker as a kwarg so the message is formatted properly.

Change-Id: I6d5c7048a5636e2cef15a6dab0d568c89e713a87
"}]
commit_message:
Don't overwrite MarkerNotFound error message

Several places raising MarkerNotFound were overwriting the
error message with the marker key. This fixes that by passing
the marker as a kwarg so the message is formatted properly.

Change-Id: I6d5c7048a5636e2cef15a6dab0d568c89e713a87
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/35/340535/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: raise exception.MarkerNotFound(marker) raise exception.MarkerNotFound(marker) raise exception.MarkerNotFound(marker)

commit_message:
Add tempest-horizon plugin installation

According to https://review.openstack.org/#/c/313713/
horizon tempest tests are no longer included into tempest,
so we need to install tempest-horizon plugin.

Change-Id: I869dad67c3b1077cbc3fd4773b999c8c430af73f

deleted_lines: $horizon_enabled = false $horizon_enabled = trueif $horizon_enabled { include ::openstack_integration::horizon } horizon => $horizon_enabled,

Add driver name in ironic scenarios

Add 'fake' driver for Ironic tests.
Changed driver name in following files:
create-and-delete-node.json
create-and-delete-node.yaml
create-and-list-node.json
create-and-list-node.yaml
rally-ironic.yaml

commit_message:
Don't use Sed's GNU extension to support MacOSX

This change removes using the Sed's GNU extensions to support BSD-Sed
in MacOSX, also moves one of them (lowercase) to the tr command.

Change-Id: I5afef3fc562443e7089b72e645b725b86781c54c
Closes-Bug: #1600793
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <mmalchuk@mirantis.com>
(cherry picked from commit 984547cc1f9b5b622d496e07c5df343667f15fba)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-virtualbox refs/changes/21/340821/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: mac_address=$(echo $mac | sed 's/..\B/&:/g;s/./\L&/g')

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-08 15:30:25.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/os-nova-install.yml', 'playbooks/os-cinder-install.yml', 'playbooks/os-glance-install.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/8fb6a3bb00c762c19ff661970693f319329ca845', 'message': 'Fix skipping Ceph client linking

When *_venv_enabled is set to False, the plays fail to set
openstack_service_venv_bin correctly (empty string) and instead
populate it with the venv path anyway.

Change-Id: I598d3c7d7261098d4b7a6cca00acdfcbb5dc066a
'}]
commit_message:
Fix skipping Ceph client linking

When *_venv_enabled is set to False, the plays fail to set
openstack_service_venv_bin correctly (empty string) and instead
populate it with the venv path anyway.

Change-Id: I598d3c7d7261098d4b7a6cca00acdfcbb5dc066a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/19/339619/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: openstack_service_venv_bin: "{{ glance_venv_bin if glance_venv_enabled|default(True)|bool else None }}"
deleted_lines: openstack_service_venv_bin: "{{ glance_venv_bin if glance_venv_enabled|default(True) else None }}"

commit_message:
Remove useless/broken call in a bagpipe driver test

Calling update_dv_port_binding is now (a) useless, and (b) broken.
This patch simply removes it.

Change-Id: I71d0b96b06eac3b917504ad7643ee9f3cf27255b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-bgpvpn refs/changes/09/340809/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Negative tests for testing chassis-create command

Negative tests for the Ironic CLI commands which check actions with
chassis-create command like create chassis without arguments or with
incorrect arguments and check that correct error message raised.

Partial-Bug: #1566211
Co-Authored-By: Kyrylo Romanenko <kromanenko@mirantis.com>
Change-Id: I01541c2cefafc4612b804646da07bf8dd5884661

commit_message:
Don't use Sed's GNU extension to support MacOSX

This change removes using the Sed's GNU extensions to support BSD-Sed
in MacOSX, also moves one of them (lowercase) to the tr command.

Change-Id: I5afef3fc562443e7089b72e645b725b86781c54c
Closes-Bug: #1600793
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <mmalchuk@mirantis.com>

added_lines: mac_address=$(echo $mac | sed 's/.\{2\}/&:/g;s/:$//') echo "The MAC address of the new node is: '${mac_address,,}'."
deleted_lines: mac_address=$(echo $mac | sed 's/..\B/&:/g;s/./\L&/g') echo "The MAC address of the new node is: '${mac_address}'."

commit_message:
Deprecate auth_region option for Glare

Patch Ie50ab3371386691b72e25e1088198c05edb920b6 is missed deprecation
for Glare service, so this patch fix it.

Also fix typo in release note.

Change-Id: If6292e518d1ccd7b83072c99cff1e76078753218
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-glance refs/changes/11/340311/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # == DEPRECATED PARAMETERS # # [*auth_region*] # (optional) The region for the authentication service. # If "use_user_token" is not in effect and using keystone auth, # then region name can be specified. # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # DEPRECATED PARAMETERS $auth_region = $::os_service_default, if $auth_region { warning('auth_region is deprecated, has no effect and and will be removed in the O release.') }
deleted_lines: # [*auth_region*] # (optional) The region for the authentication service. # If "use_user_token" is not in effect and using keystone auth, # then region name can be specified. # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # $auth_region = $::os_service_default, 'DEFAULT/auth_region': value => $auth_region;

commit_message:
Add a bandit non-voting for Kolla

This adds a non-voting job for Bandit
to the kolla project.  Once Kolla
has an operational bandit, we will make the gate
voting and add it to bandit integration gate.

Depends-On: Iea23a9bd23b25827043f02aa1a62fb0724f1d0ee
Change-Id: Iec8182d41c3b665fa19ea9ff7c528fa4b3dfb714

subject: Add __ne__ built-in function
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-05 00:43:52.000000000', 'files': ['aodh/tests/functional/api/v2/test_alarm_scenarios.py', 'aodh/storage/base.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/aodh/commit/735fb21e00bbe8ef45fd5ef101c02bbb524b3531', 'message': 'Add __ne__ built-in function

In Python 3 __ne__ by default delegates to __eq__ and inverts the
result, but in Python 2 they urge you to define __ne__ when you
define __eq__ for it to work properly [1].There are no implied
relationships among the comparison operators. The truth of x==y
does not imply that x!=y is false. Accordingly, when defining
__eq__(), one should also define __ne__() so that the operators
will behave as expected.
[1]https://docs.python.org/2/reference/datamodel.html#object.__ne__

Change-Id: I24e1f91b9db9da1a557e9812a7bf4af1a7c25d32

commit_message:
Add __ne__ built-in function

In Python 3 __ne__ by default delegates to __eq__ and inverts the
result, but in Python 2 they urge you to define __ne__ when you
define __eq__ for it to work properly [1].There are no implied
relationships among the comparison operators. The truth of x==y
does not imply that x!=y is false. Accordingly, when defining
__eq__(), one should also define __ne__() so that the operators
will behave as expected.
[1]https://docs.python.org/2/reference/datamodel.html#object.__ne__

Change-Id: I24e1f91b9db9da1a557e9812a7bf4af1a7c25d32
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/aodh refs/changes/88/337388/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def __ne__(self, other): return not self.__eq__(other)

Updates microversion root and error messages

This change updates the microversion http errors, headers,
and root response messages to match microversion specs
that can be found here:
https://specs.openstack.org/opnstack/api-wg/guidelines/
microversion_specifications.html

Closes-Bug: #1569777

Change-Id: I18f52e569aeafaa98c56136d33d152fa420d9e1c

commit_message:
tempest: Allow the old-style name project name

Tempest renamed a config option from the auth section called
"admin_tenant_name" to "admin_project_name".
To be able to run the magnum tempest tests with an older
version of tempest, also check for "admin_tenant_name" if
"admin_project_name" is not available.

Change-Id: I39de0978f36fd04ce1959d3904f1da55370e13aa
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/86/339086/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from oslo_config import cfg # NOTE(toabctl): also allow the old style tempest definition try: cls.admin_tenant = CONF.auth.admin_project_name except cfg.NoSuchOptError: cls.admin_tenant = CONF.auth.admin_tenant_name # NOTE(toabctl): also allow the old style tempest definition try: cls.tenant = CONF.auth.admin_project_name except cfg.NoSuchOptError: cls.tenant = CONF.auth.admin_tenant_name
deleted_lines: cls.admin_tenant = CONF.auth.admin_project_name cls.tenant = CONF.auth.admin_project_name

commit_message:
Extract fuel2 client calling to separate function

  Also --debug flag has been added for more meaningful error reporting.
  Without --debug flag fuel2 client doesn't provide full error messsage
  in case of error.

Closes-Bug: 1588955
Change-Id: I53873fdb745d7cc368040a72496f7ccfa5e3a8b4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-octane refs/changes/04/325504/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: res = fuel2_env_call(["clone", "-f", "json", str(env_id), uuid.uuid4().hex, str(release.data['id'])], output=True) call_args = ['clone-ips', str(orig_id)] fuel2_env_call(call_args) cmd = ["move", "node"] fuel2_env_call(cmd_move_node) fuel2_env_call(["copy", "vips", str(env.data['id'])]) def fuel2_env_call(args, fail_on_error=True, output=False): cmd = ["fuel2", "--debug", "env"] + args try: if output: return subprocess.call_output(cmd) else: subprocess.call(cmd) except subprocess.CalledProcessError: LOG.warn("Fuel2 client returned non-zero exit code " "for following arguments: %s", ' '.join(cmd)) if fail_on_error: raise Exception("Fuel2 client returned non-zero " "exit code for following arguments: %s" % ' '.join(cmd))
deleted_lines: res = subprocess.call_output( ["fuel2", "env", "clone", "-f", "json", str(env_id), uuid.uuid4().hex, str(release.data['id'])], ) call_args = ['fuel2', 'env', 'clone-ips', str(orig_id)] subprocess.call(call_args) cmd = ["fuel2", "env", "move", "node"] subprocess.call(cmd_move_node) subprocess.call( ["fuel2", "env", "copy", "vips", str(env.data['id'])] )

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/56/340356/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ================================= Installation tutorials and guides ================================= For the Newton release, a new method of publishing Installation tutorials and guides is being implemented. This will allow each big tent project to create their own Installation Guide, based on a standard template, in their own repository. These guides are then centrally published to `docs.openstack.org <http://docs.openstack.org>`_.To create or update master index file, create or update the ``www/project-install-guide/RELEASE/index.html`` file at the ``openstack-manuals`` repository. For draft (unreleased) version, replace ``RELEASE`` with ``draft``.
deleted_lines: =============================== Project specific install guides =============================== For the Newton release, a new method of publishing Installation Guides is being implemented. This will allow each big tent project to create their own Installation Guide, based on a standard template, in their own repository. These guides are then centrally published to `docs.openstack.org <http://docs.openstack.org>`_. TBD: How to create master index file for this.

commit_message:
[WIP] Strategy selector select based on efficacy

[WIP] In this changeset, the strategy selector has been updated to
now select the most suited strategy given a goal based on the
average score of the global efficacy.

Partially Implements: blueprint efficacy-indicator

Change-Id: Ide99f085a9d069822345bb7dcb7c805358cd7c1f

commit_message:
Allow Octane to use non-root user and sudo.

Adding 4 options to Octane:
    --ssh-user
    --ssh-password
    --ssh-password-inline
    --sudo

to allow Octane to SSH as a non-root user and prepend all commands
with `sudo`.  It will also spawn `sftp-server` using sudo so that
the SFTP client in Paramiko will work as-is.

Change-Id: I0560587c8f27447c7683e5a8fd2b643730d83bce
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-octane refs/changes/29/326129/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: check-sudo = octane.commands.check_sudo:CheckSudoCommand

commit_message:
[contrib-guide] Remove O'Reilly guidelines

Remove heading guidelines for the Operations Guide,
since we decided at the Austin Design Summit to no
longer publish with O'Reilly.

Change-Id: Ic341951974fbf8df495c5d5b061f6b090ed2a618
Implements: blueprint contributor-guide-reorg
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/54/340754/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: * Use sentence-style capitalization except for the Operations Guide, which follows the `O'Reilly heading capitalization style <http://chimera.labs.oreilly.com/books/1230000000969/ch02.html#headings>`_, and book titles.

added_lines: #!/bin/sh . /etc/sysconfig/heat-params if [ "$NETWORK_DRIVER" != "flannel" ]; then exit 0 fi . /etc/sysconfig/flanneld FLANNEL_CONFIG_BIN=/usr/local/bin/flannel-config FLANNEL_CONFIG_SERVICE=/etc/systemd/system/flannel-config.service FLANNEL_JSON=/etc/sysconfig/flannel-network.json echo "creating $FLANNEL_CONFIG_BIN" cat > $FLANNEL_CONFIG_BIN <<EOF #!/bin/sh if ! [ -f "$FLANNEL_JSON" ]; then echo "ERROR: missing network configuration file" >&2 exit 1 fi if ! [ "$FLANNEL_ETCD" ] && [ "$FLANNEL_ETCD_KEY" ]; then echo "ERROR: missing required configuration" >&2 exit 1 fi echo "creating flanneld config in etcd" while ! curl -sf -L $FLANNEL_ETCD/v2/keys${FLANNEL_ETCD_KEY}/config \ -X PUT --data-urlencode value@${FLANNEL_JSON}; do echo "waiting for etcd" sleep 1 done EOF cat > $FLANNEL_CONFIG_SERVICE <<EOF [Unit] After=etcd.service Requires=etcd.service [Service] Type=oneshot EnvironmentFile=/etc/sysconfig/flanneld ExecStart=$FLANNEL_CONFIG_BIN [Install] WantedBy=multi-user.target EOF chown root:root $FLANNEL_CONFIG_BIN chmod 0755 $FLANNEL_CONFIG_BIN chown root:root $FLANNEL_CONFIG_SERVICE chmod 0644 $FLANNEL_CONFIG_SERVICE systemctl enable flannel-config systemctl start --no-block flannel-config

commit_message:
Bump up the number of OVB env workers available

We currently have infra limited to 15 CI slaves so on paper
having 15 testenv works should be perfect. Except when zuul
kills a job while it is running and as a result the client
doesn't free the environment, in this case zuul starts a
new ci slave but the testenv worker doesn't get freed up until
up too 2 hours later(depending on how long its already been
running for).

Have some spare workers lieing around so that we will be less
effected by workers waiting to timeout. Also bump up infras
quota to allow for the extra testenvs lieing around.

Closes-Bug: #1600787
Change-Id: I48677d65f0c200c9026b97c9b6cd21eaf0d84aaf

commit_message:
Move file operations for network configuration

This patch moves all file operations related to network
configuration management from library to CLI.

Change-Id: Iecb9c688cfa9653451d186f98583d77508924583
Partial-bug: #1561632
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-fuelclient refs/changes/16/305716/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2016 Mirantis, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import os from oslo_utils import fileutils from fuelclient.cli import error class FileOperationsCommand(object): """Adds common methods for file operations.""" def get_network_data_path(self, network_id, directory=os.curdir): return os.path.join(os.path.abspath(directory), "network_{0}".format(network_id)) def read_network_data(self, network_id, serializer, directory=os.curdir): if not os.path.isdir(directory): raise error.InvalidDirectoryException('"{0}" does not exists or ' 'is not a directory') network_file_path = self.get_network_data_path(network_id, directory) return serializer.read_from_file(network_file_path) def write_network_data(self, network_id, network_data, serializer, directory=os.curdir): try: fileutils.ensure_tree(directory) except OSError as e: raise error.InvalidDirectoryException('Cannot write to "{0}". ' 'The path is not writable ' 'or is not a directory.') return serializer.write_to_path(self.get_network_data_path(directory), network_data)

rest api version bumped for async pre live migration checks

pre live-migration checks now are done in async way. This patch
updates rest api version to keep this tracked.

bp: async-live-migration-rest-check

commit_message:
Add new documentation section for Watcher policies rules

We can now use policies to allow or not users to invoke Watcher API
methods. I added, in the Admin guide section, a new documentation
introducing watcher policy rules.

Change-Id: Ie1f8a9e15561756f23242c6f6b0d53cdacf3505a

commit_message:
Save valid udid on pre_live_migration of vscsi volumes using multi VIOS

The pre_live_migration_on_destination operation for vscsi volumes saved
the udid to be used later during cleanup. In cases where the target
contains multiple VIOS and if one of them do not contain valid ports
then the mig_data will set with udid as None.

Adding code to set the udid only if it is not None.

Change-Id: I3412663a6dab828bbfa2f7fa1c938aa956b7b315
Closes-Bug: 1598393
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-powervm refs/changes/83/336783/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # if valid udid is returned save in mig_data if udid is not None: mig_data['vscsi-' + volume_id] = udid udid = migrate_data.get('vscsi-' + self.volume_id, None) udid = migrate_data.get('vscsi-' + self.volume_id, None)
deleted_lines: mig_data['vscsi-' + volume_id] = udid udid = migrate_data.get('vscsi-' + self.volume_id) udid = migrate_data.get('vscsi-' + self.volume_id)

Also do not display hidden attributes.

commit_message:
Decouple galera client role from OSA inventory groups

Adding these group vars files and setting galera_client_drop_config_file in
them allows the galera client role and other roles that have been split out
into their own repositories to break their direct dependency on/knowledge of
the OSA inventory group model.

Change-Id: I0f5813299d577afae19b8e75a40f986a733f5242
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/29/289029/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- galera_client_drop_config_file: true

commit_message:
Adding requests to bootstrap ansible

The requests package is used on the base system and needs to be installed
early. This package is eventually installed when the lxc-hosts play is
executed which is pulled in via the "lxc-template" dependency. However due
to recent changes in the "human_log" plugin as found here [0] we need to
have this package installed sooner.

[0] - https://github.com/openstack/openstack-ansible-plugins/commit/aa69b10a1a625249696389742353432cb93f13c6

Change-Id: Id9475134950f329f777144dedb0e7c2c910ef009
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/86/340486/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: apt-get update && apt-get -y install git python-all python-dev curl python2.7-dev build-essential libssl-dev libffi-dev python-requests < /dev/null yum check-update && yum -y install git python2 curl autoconf gcc-c++ python2-devel gcc libffi-devel openssl-devel python-requests dnf -y install git python curl autoconf gcc-c++ python-devel gcc libffi-devel openssl-devel python-requests
deleted_lines: apt-get update && apt-get -y install git python-all python-dev curl python2.7-dev build-essential libssl-dev libffi-dev < /dev/null yum check-update && yum -y install git python2 curl autoconf gcc-c++ python2-devel gcc libffi-devel openssl-devel dnf -y install git python curl autoconf gcc-c++ python-devel gcc libffi-devel openssl-devel

commit_message:
Don't run gate-cinder-tox-db-functional on stable/liberty

Functional tests do not exist on stable/liberty, so do not
run them.

Change-Id: I0b582ac2c7c227faf72bf701dfa88e83a8ba9ee6
Closes-Bug: #1602024

commit_message:
Remove neutron full job from neutron-vpnaas queues

This job is no longer executing any VPN code so it is
just wasting precious cycles.

them from Zuul.

commit_message:
[cli-ref] Update python-troveclient to 2.3.0

Change-Id: I0191605d238b261941853f40a6ac3870e0b119f6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/33/340633/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: This chapter documents :command:`trove` version ``2.3.0``. usage: trove [--version] [--debug] [--service-type <service-type>] [--service-name <service-name>] [--bypass-url <bypass-url>] [--os-key <key>] [--timeout <seconds>] [--os-auth-type <name>] [--os-trust-id OS_TRUST_ID] [--os-default-domain-id OS_DEFAULT_DOMAIN_ID] [--os-default-domain-name OS_DEFAULT_DOMAIN_NAME] [--os-user-id OS_USER_ID] [--os-username OS_USERNAME] [--os-password OS_PASSWORD] [--os-region-name <region-name>]``--os-auth-type <name>, --os-auth-plugin <name>`` Authentication type to use ID or name of the datastore (to filter backups by). ID or name of the backup. [--locality <policy>] Add an instance to the cluster. Specify``--locality <policy>`` Locality policy to use when creating cluster. Choose one of affinity, anti- affinity. Valid options are: flavor=<flavor_name_or_id>, volume=<disk_size_in_GB>, volume_type=<type>, nic='<net-id=<net-uuid>, v4-fixed-ip=<ip-addr>, port-id=<port-uuid>>' (where net-id=network_id, v4-fixed- ip=IPv4r_fixed_address, port-id=port_id), availability_zone=<AZ_hint_for_Nova>, ID or name of the configuration group to attach to the instance. ID or name of the configuration group. ID or name of the configuration group. ID or name of the configuration group. ID or name of the configuration group. ID or name of the configuration group. [--module <module>] [--locality <policy>] A flavor name or ID. A backup name or ID. Number of replicas to create (defaults to 1 if replica_of specified).``--locality <policy>`` Locality policy to use when creating replicas. Choose one of affinity, anti- affinity.
deleted_lines: This chapter documents :command:`trove` version ``2.2.0``. usage: trove [--version] [--debug] [--os-auth-system <auth-system>] [--service-type <service-type>] [--service-name <service-name>] [--bypass-url <bypass-url>] [--os-key <key>] [--timeout <seconds>] [--os-trust-id OS_TRUST_ID] [--os-user-id OS_USER_ID] [--os-username OS_USERNAME] [--os-password OS_PASSWORD] [--os-tenant-name <auth-tenant-name>] [--os-tenant-id <tenant-id>] [--os-auth-token OS_AUTH_TOKEN] [--os-region-name <region-name>]``--os-auth-system <auth-system>`` Defaults to ``env[OS_AUTH_SYSTEM]``. ``--insecure`` Explicitly allow client to perform "insecure" TLS (https) requests. The server's certificate will not be verified against any certificate authorities. This option should be used with caution. ``--os-cacert <ca-certificate>`` Specify a CA bundle file to use in verifying a TLS (https) server certificate. Defaults to ``env[OS_CACERT]``. ``--os-cert <certificate>`` Defaults to ``env[OS_CERT]``. ``--os-key <key>`` Defaults to ``env[OS_KEY]``. ``--timeout <seconds>`` Set request timeout (in seconds). ``--os-auth-url OS_AUTH_URL`` Authentication URL ``--os-domain-id OS_DOMAIN_ID`` Domain ID to scope to ``--os-domain-name OS_DOMAIN_NAME`` Domain name to scope to ``--os-project-id OS_PROJECT_ID`` Project ID to scope to ``--os-project-name OS_PROJECT_NAME`` Project name to scope to ``--os-project-domain-id OS_PROJECT_DOMAIN_ID`` Domain ID containing project ``--os-project-domain-name OS_PROJECT_DOMAIN_NAME`` Domain name containing project ``--os-trust-id OS_TRUST_ID`` Trust ID ``--os-user-id OS_USER_ID`` User ID ``--os-username OS_USERNAME, --os-user_name OS_USERNAME`` Username ``--os-user-domain-id OS_USER_DOMAIN_ID`` User's domain id ``--os-user-domain-name OS_USER_DOMAIN_NAME`` User's domain name ``--os-password OS_PASSWORD`` User's password ``--os-tenant-name <auth-tenant-name>`` Tenant to request authorization on. Defaults to ``env[OS_TENANT_NAME]``. ``--os-tenant-id <tenant-id>`` Tenant to request authorization on. Defaults to ``env[OS_TENANT_ID]``. ``--os-auth-token OS_AUTH_TOKEN`` Defaults to ``env[OS_AUTH_TOKEN]`` Name or ID of the datastore to list backups for. ID of the backup. Create an instance for the cluster. Specify Valid options are: name=<name>, flavor=<flavor_name_or_id>, volume=<volume>, ID of the configuration group to attach to the instance. ID of the configuration group. ID of the configuration group. ID of the configuration group. ID of the configuration group. ID of the configuration group. [--module <module>] Flavor ID or name of the instance. A backup ID. Number of replicas to create (defaults to 1).

Add support continuously-optimization

This patch set adds support for interval
field to python-watcherclient

Depends-On: I5f4ec97b2082c8a6b3ccebe36b2a343fa4a67d19
Implements: blueprint continuously-optimization

commit_message:
Make default Planner generic to handle new action

Currently we have to amend the code of the Planner
for each new added Watcher Action. This patch set will
modifying the DefaultPlanner class and  leverage the
plugins-parameters blueprint so that we can configure
weights via the configuration file.

Documentation and unittest also be update in this patch.

Co-Authored-By: Vincent Françoise <vincent.francoise@b-com.com>

Change-Id: Ib794488fcafd1e153a7d7b1f7253686136501872
blueprint: configurable-weights-default-planner
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/watcher refs/changes/21/338921/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: with mock.patch.object( pbase.DefaultPlanner, "get_config_opts", wraps=default_planner.get_config_opts) as m_get_cfg_opts: m_get_cfg_opts.return_value = {'migrate': 3} action_plan = default_planner.schedule(self.context, audit.id, solution) with mock.patch.object( pbase.DefaultPlanner, "get_config_opts", wraps=default_planner.get_config_opts) as m_get_cfg_opts: m_get_cfg_opts.return_value = {'migrate': 3, 'nop': 0} action_plan = default_planner.schedule(self.context, audit.id, solution) def test_schedule_actions_with_unknown_action(self): default_planner = pbase.DefaultPlanner(mock.Mock()) audit = db_utils.create_test_audit(uuid=utils.generate_uuid()) solution = dsol.DefaultSolution( goal=mock.Mock(), strategy=mock.Mock()) parameters = { "src_uuid_hypervisor": "server1", "dst_uuid_hypervisor": "server2", } solution.add_action(action_type="migrate", resource_id="b199db0c-1408-4d52-b5a5-5ca14de0ff36", input_parameters=parameters) solution.add_action(action_type="new_action_type", resource_id="", input_parameters={}) with mock.patch.object( pbase.DefaultPlanner, "create_action", wraps=default_planner.create_action) as m_create_action: with mock.patch.object( pbase.DefaultPlanner, "get_config_opts", wraps=default_planner.get_config_opts) as m_get_cfg_opts: m_get_cfg_opts.return_value = {'migrate': 0} self.assertRaises(TypeError, default_planner.schedule( self.context, audit.id, solution)) self.assertEqual(2, m_create_action.call_count)
deleted_lines: action_plan = default_planner.schedule( self.context, audit.id, solution ) action_plan = default_planner.schedule( self.context, audit.id, solution )

Add docker and mitaka support.

Change-Id: I553b375be013c7ea52f68177149962e490297ffd

commit_message:
Correct the rest of the reraising of exception

When an exception was caught and rethrown, it should call 'raise'
without any arguments because it shows the place where an exception
occured initially instead of place where the exception re-raised.

Change-Id: I696054fc273edb62e87e5d567da6b99cdf5ec358
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/27/340227/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Cleanup/standardize usage of tags

The numerous tags within the role have been condensed
to two tags: horizon-install and horizon-config

These tags have been chosen as they are namespaced
and cover the two major functions of the role.

Documentation has been updated to inform how each tag
influences the function of the role.

Change-Id: I02e5ee7c2975325bfa479f23ae1001095f664dcb

commit_message:
Disable UMM before nodes repetitive restart

The problem is that after third reboot nodes are going
into maintenance mode and became unavailable for further
testing. We need disable UMM feature to prevent such behaviour.

Change-Id: I1cce936201872f47d13e3c482e23e1ba4cfc24b2
Closes-Bug: #1588877

commit_message:
Magic-Search isn't rendered unless config is ready

This patch alleviates a problem where sometimes the magic-search element
needs to be rendered, but the configuration isn't ready yet.  This simply
skips the rendering unless the primary configuration parameters are in place.

This is evident when Launch Instance is launched via an item action, such as
within the Image items.

Change-Id: I10452428e2d17cd17c98c65cbf8147dc7ab14621
Closes-Bug: 1600352

commit_message:
Maximum/Total value now included as variable in msgid (i18n)

This patch makes possible to include a maximum/total numeric value
as a variable in the msgid, making it possible for translators to put
this variable in any position they want.



Change-Id: I856d3d454401a236feaf065d347bc2a48f7ef54c
Closes-bug: #1558292

commit_message:
Work around Ansible processor fact bug on ppc64le

This works around a bug in Ansible where ansible_processor_count is
reported as 0 on ppc64le today due to issues with /proc/cpuinfo
format differences. See this issue [1] for current status.

[1] - https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/16533

Change-Id: Icc26c415fb36aefc6ad22eb76073bcd1f8878466
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-repo_build refs/changes/04/336604/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Remove mox from unit/compute/test_compute.py (4)

Stop using mox in test_compute.py in below test cases:
- test_live_migration_exception_rolls_back
- test_pre_live_migration_works_correctly
- test_pre_live_migration_instance_has_no_fixed_ip
- test_live_migration_works_correctly

Partially implements: blueprint remove-mox-newton
Change-Id: I6d422e0e6d29492a1c449039c04f6d38afa94d5c

commit_message:
Remove mox from unit/compute/test_compute.py (3)

Stop using mox in test_compute.py in below test cases:
- test_network_is_deallocated_on_spawn_failure
- test_delete_instance_loses_net_on_other_fail
- test_delete_instance_keeps_net_on_power_off_fail
- test_run_instance_queries_macs
- test_terminate_no_network
- test_quotas_successful_delete
- test_quotas_successful_soft_delete
- test_finish_resize_with_volumes
- test_finish_resize_from_active
- test_finish_resize_from_stopped
- test_finish_resize_without_resize_instance
- test_confirm_resize_from_active
- test_confirm_resize_from_stopped
- test_confirm_resize_with_migration_context

- test_quotas_destroy_of_soft_deleted_instance
- test_finish_resize_handles_error
- test_prep_resize_instance_migration_error_on_none_host
- test_resize_instance_driver_error
- test_resize_instance_driver_rollback
- test_resize_instance_handles_migration_error

commit_message:
Initialize the routers key in make_bgpvpn_dict

This patch prevents to trigger an error with OpenContrail when a
network association is declared on a network bounded to a router.

Change-Id: I61e699690c86e523e0479a4cb34d3db5f6b9ed0c
Closes-bug: 1596962
Closes-bug: 1598807

commit_message:
Remove mox from unit/compute/test_compute.py (1)

Stop using mox in test_compute.py in below test cases:
- test_detach_volume_usage
- test_poll_volume_usage_with_data
- test_poll_volume_usage_returns_no_vols
- test_poll_volume_usage_disabled
- test_poll_bandwidth_usage_not_implemented

Partially implements: blueprint remove-mox-newton

Change-Id: I62b14df139922e7a71068d047972b9aa5f5843eb

commit_message:
Only install to virtual environment

Remove all tasks and variables related to toggling between installation
of swift inside or outside of a Python virtual environment.
Installing within a venv is now the only supported deployment.

Additionally, a few changes have been made to make the creation of the
venv more resistant to interruptions during a run of the role.
* unarchiving a pre-built venv will now also occur when the venv
  directory is created, not only after being downloaded
* virtualenv-tools is run against both pre-built and non pre-built venvs
  to account for interruptions during or prior to unarchiving

Change-Id: Id2a27c082a5eb4eddc9eacde9de30f4e61f9ec36
Implements: blueprint only-install-venvs

commit_message:
Upgrade RabbitMQ Server to 3.6.3

Change the default install version of RabbitMQ Server to 3.6.3.

The 3.6.3 Debian package adds support for systemd and no longer leaves a
rabbitmq-server process running for signal handling to the erlang VM.
The `pgrep` command checking that rabbitmq is running has been updated
to search entire process names to account for this change.

Change-Id: I742b03f64cd0232835b7143507e3d3cd14d79f23

commit_message:
Remove static log-file parameter from init

The init/systemd scripts support dynamic parameters to be passed
to init services, however there is a static --log-file option that
was configured to be passed to ALL services using the init templates.

For services that are implemented which do not support --log-file
parameters this causes a startup failure ie.
calico-felix: error: no such option: --log-file

This change moves the --log-file parameter into the neutron_services
dictionary, allowing the parameter to be passed on a per-service basis.

Change-Id: I9e98f730e3d167feb40c2f7e898c10f53041bffd

commit_message:
Cleanup/standardize usage of tags

The tags within the role have been condensed
to two tags: openrc-install and openrc-config

These tags have been chosen as they are namespaced
and cover the two major functions of the role.

Documentation has been updated to inform how each tag
influences the function of the role.

Change-Id: I2968884300d753f2c75279cccca4c896287ea83b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-openstack_openrc refs/changes/09/340409/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ================================== Tags ==== This role supports two tags: ``openrc-install`` and ``openrc-config`` The ``openrc-install`` tag can be used to install and upgrade. The ``openrc-config`` tag can be used to manage configuration.

commit_message:
Ansible 2.x - Address deprecation warning of bare variables

Ansible 2.2 will not allow "bare" variable references
in with_* loops. See https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/porting_guide_2.0.html#deprecated
for details.

Change-Id: I0e14d913a069fa25b90cfd8daf922ae093056203

commit_message:
Move rabbit configurations to oslo_messaging_rabbit section

Configuration with oslo.messaging is listed in the DEFAULT section
in etc/barbican/barbican.conf.
According to this Change "I96a9682afe7eb0caf1fbf47bbb0291833aec245b"
of oslo.messaging, we now prefer to set them in "oslo_messaging_rabbit"
section.

Closes-Bug: #1590231
Change-Id: I2b952012b2192cfb95e28cf11f78cf56d6a414ca
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/barbican refs/changes/01/328701/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: [oslo_messaging_rabbit]

commit_message:
Trival: Replace logging with oslo_log

If we use logging lib to initialize a logger, the logger won't be applied
the oslo_log config options.

trival-fix

Change-Id: I2dcaa11d9c846b5a699b15c5ce19065b98ec81ec

commit_message:
made small changes to introduction doc

cleaned up doc
added “the” where necessary and “a” where necessary
to complete the sentence.
changed to “The OpenStack Community”
removed “a bit longer” and changed to “Longer Answer”
changed to plurals where necessary

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/performance-docs refs/changes/94/339594/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: OpenStack developers, QA engineers and operators to have a unified way for their projects and products evaluation and the best recipes for doing this.Short answer: The OpenStack community. Longer answer: performance engineers from various companies, cloud operators, OpenStack project developers, etc. We all are part of the **Performance Team**. Therefore, here you can find test plans and methodologies that were written keeping in mind all of these groups of people, their interests and experiences.
deleted_lines: OpenStack developers, QA engineers and operators to have unified way for their projects and products evaluation and best recipes for doing this.Short answer: OpenStack community. A bit longer answer: performance engineers from various companies, cloud operators, OpenStack projects developers, etc. We all are part of **Performance Team**. Therefore you can find here test plans and methodologies, that were written keeping in mind all these groups of people, their interest and experience.

Add an experimental grenade multinode job for Neutron Linuxbridge

https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/neutron-multinode-jobs-newton

Change-Id: I249a0e15ae951b5d58b2cfd8bda2fcca85afd528

name: '{pipeline}-grenade-dsvm-neutron-linuxbridge-multinode{job-suffix}' node: '{node}' wrappers: - build-timeout: timeout: 125 - timestamps builders: - link-logs - net-info - devstack-checkout - shell: | #!/bin/bash -xe export PYTHONUNBUFFERED=true export DEVSTACK_GATE_NEUTRON=1 export DEVSTACK_GATE_CONFIGDRIVE=0 export DEVSTACK_GATE_GRENADE=pullup export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG="Q_AGENT=linuxbridge"$'

commit_message:
Remove unhelpful test of oslo.service ServiceLauncher

Similar to what has been done in [1], we should not test functionality
that is internal to oslo.service, so remove the corresponding test.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/316331

Change-Id: I2daa1d67a8a0dbe1f1ef5af333746b23e9edc3bb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-dynamic-routing refs/changes/74/340274/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: def test_bgp_dragent_main_agent_manager(self): logging_str = 'neutron.agent.common.config.setup_logging' launcher_str = 'oslo_service.service.ServiceLauncher' with mock.patch(logging_str): with mock.patch.object(sys, 'argv') as sys_argv: with mock.patch(launcher_str) as launcher: sys_argv.return_value = ['bgp_dragent', '--config-file', base.etcdir('neutron.conf')] entry.main() if launcher.mock_calls[0][2]: launcher.assert_has_calls( [mock.call(cfg.CONF, restart_method='reload'), mock.call().launch_service(mock.ANY, workers=1), mock.call().wait()]) else: launcher.assert_has_calls( [mock.call(cfg.CONF), mock.call().launch_service(mock.ANY), mock.call().wait()])

subject: Disconnect multipath iscsi may logout session
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-31 07:36:20.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/os-brick/commit/b1f0118e31caadc1fedb0b2d7571223ef6a18ce2', 'message': 'Disconnect multipath iscsi may logout session

In file connector.py function _disconnect_volume_multipath_iscsi may
logout session being used.In file connector.py function
_get_multipath_device_map is an utility to identify IQNs by using
multipath device map (/dev/sdX => /dev/mapper/XXX) generated by
'multipath -ll'. Function get_all_block_devices() gets the list of
all block devices seen in "/dev/disk/by-path/".In line 1140:mpdev =
mpath_map.get(dev) could not get multipath device by key "dev"
(/dev/disk/by-path/entry), then may logout session being used.
We need get the name of "dev"(/dev/sdX) instead of
"/dev/disk/by-path/entry".

Change-Id: Ia0cd914b4d9e5a050fa80eaebfecf1b384d9ee09
Closes-Bug: #1587256
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-31 09:05:42.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/os-brick/commit/1ae1c44b103a381aa842294b8cdf355ce861085f', 'message': 'Disconnect multipath iscsi may logout session

When disconnectting a volume multipath iscsi, we get multipath device
name through a dict(/dev/sdX：/dev/mapper/XXX) by key
"/dev/disk/by-path/entry". But we can not get multipath device because
of the unmatched key, then disconnect from iscsi portal. But in most
case, we have others devices and the disconnectting may lead to others
devices cannot be used. So we need translates the key
from"/dev/disk/by-path/entry" to "/dev/sdX".

Change-Id: Ia0cd914b4d9e5a050fa80eaebfecf1b384d9ee09
Closes-Bug: #1587256
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2016-05-31 11:23:04.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/os-brick/commit/39b9f0519a643f2b8b5d6a3bb2c4ca792ff11689', 'message': 'Disconnect multipath iscsi may logout session

When disconnectting a volume multipath iscsi, we get multipath device
name through a dict(/dev/sdX：/dev/mapper/XXX) by key
"/dev/disk/by-path/entry". But we can not get multipath device because
of the unmatched key, then disconnect from iscsi portal. But in most
case, we have others devices and the disconnectting may lead to others
devices cannot be used. This patch fixes it by translating the key
from"/dev/disk/by-path/entry" to "/dev/sdX".

Change-Id: Ia0cd914b4d9e5a050fa80eaebfecf1b384d9ee09

commit_message:
Disconnect multipath iscsi may logout session

When disconnecting a volume multipath iscsi, we get multipath device
name through a dict(/dev/sdX：/dev/mapper/XXX) by key
"/dev/disk/by-path/entry". But we can not get multipath device because
of the unmatched key, then disconnect from iscsi portal. But in most
cases, we have others devices and the disconnecting may lead to others
devices cannot be used. This patch fixes it by translating the key
from"/dev/disk/by-path/entry" to "/dev/sdX".

Change-Id: Ia0cd914b4d9e5a050fa80eaebfecf1b384d9ee09
Closes-Bug: #1587256

As an operator, when I am running a setup with two network nodes, the
idea of running L3 HA is that an outage of one of the network nodes
should have minimum customer impact. With the current rules in place,
existing setups will indeed have little to no impact, but customers will
not be able to create new routers during the outage.

With this chance in place, we can set min_l3_agents_per_router=1, so the
customers will be affected even less. New routers will be created with
just one instance, which certainly is not optimal, but at least will
fulfill the customer request. Once the second network node recovers, the

commit_message:
Allow min_l3_agents_per_router to equal one

As an operator, when I am running a setup with two network nodes, the
idea of running L3 HA is that an outage of one of the network nodes
should have minimum customer impact. With the current rules in place,
existing setups will indeed have little to no impact, but customers will
not be able to create new routers during the outage.

With this chance in place, we can set min_l3_agents_per_router=1, so the
customers will be affected even less. New routers will be created with
just one instance, which certainly is not optimal, but at least will
fulfill the customer request. Once the second network node recovers, the
second router instance will be added and thus redundancy restored.

Also change the help text to specify the effect of setting
min_l3_agents_per_router more clearly.

Conflicts:
	neutron/db/l3_hamode_db.py
	neutron/extensions/l3_ext_ha_mode.py

Closes-Bug: 1555042
Change-Id: I8a5fc74a96c784d474aefe2d9b27eeb66521ca82
(cherry picked from commit ab131ee0af32d9eea04f1403a9a134a070e80e02)

commit_message:
Adding openstackclient support for vlan-aware-vms functionality.

This is a patch for vlan-aware-vms api for openstackclient.
This contains the create, delete, update, show, and list client
APIs for the new Trunk API.

Implements: blueprint vlan-aware-vms

commit_message:
Spec: Server interaction approach

This spec describes the approach of interaction with OpenStack
API which should be used by the library.

Change-Id: Iedc85d5bb2518b4099177d6db31abddbabafa03b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/js-openstack-lib refs/changes/01/333901/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: :: Copyright 2016 Mirantis, Inc. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode .. ======================================= Interaction with OpenStack Services API ======================================= We need to agree on the approach that will be used for interaction with OpenStack services API that would fit needs of library users. Problem Description =================== Choice of a method of communication with OpenStack API it the key decision for the project. The main requirement here is that the chosen method must be isomorphic - the same code must work both with the latest versions of popular browsers (Chrome 50, Firefox 47) and Node v4. Proposed Change =============== This project will use window.fetch() function to interact with OpenStack API. fetch() is a modern XMLHTTPRequest with a frendlier interface, which is supported by majority of the browsers. For browsers which don't support it, there is a very popular `polyfill`_ from Github. For node.js `node-fetch`_ module should be used. It implements the same fetch() interface which works on node.js environments. fetch() should be called directly from clients, without any extra wrappers. Such wrapper could be added later, for example, to handle caching and parallel requests, but there should be a separate spec for this. Alternatives ------------ There are a few isomorphic libraries for making HTTP requests and interacting with REST API. I think the project should stick to fetch() because: * Libraries for making HTTP requests (like `superagent`_) were mostly created when there was no fetch(). They mostly do the same thing - provide a friendlier interface over XMLHTTPRequest. Since there is fetch() standard, it makes very little sense to use them. * There is `isomorphic-fetch`_ module, which is more popular than `node-fetch`_. It implements XMLHttpRequest to node.js environment to run browser-specific polyfill. Approach of `node-fetch`_ which implements fetch() using node "http" module (without implementing XMLHTTPRequest) is considered simpler. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: vkramskikh Gerrit Topic ------------ Use Gerrit topic "neverland" for all patches related to this spec. .. code-block:: bash git-review -t neverland Work Items ---------- * Add node-fetch to the project dependencies. Documentation ------------- The process of creating a new OpenStack service client using the approach described in this spec should be documented. Security -------- None Testing ------- Tests will be written for node and browsers. Dependencies ============ Since node-fetch is a project dependency, but it shouldn't be included in the browser build, most likely we need to implement transpiling and build systems first. .. _polyfill: https://github.com/github/fetch .. _node-fetch: https://github.com/bitinn/node-fetch .. _superagent: https://github.com/visionmedia/superagent .. _isomorphic-fetch: https://github.com/matthew-andrews/isomorphic-fetch

commit_message:
Moving the OPTIONAL_FIELDS inside the OVO  object

In working patch 251989, Michal Dulko points out that
all the OVOs should have OPTIONAL_FIELDS inside object.

This patch will fix the issue in OVO, CGSnapshot.

Now that the OPTIONAL_FIELDS is part of the class definition,
_from_db_object should no longer be a staticmethod,
but should be a classmethod.

Change-Id: I9603cc3839dfd6e1cf102a77aeed3e9edc661bb4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/42/338542/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Clean up service version history comments
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-05 23:58:45.000000000', 'files': ['nova/objects/service.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/84473e58bfff0fbe33da876f33cf231f66d7f842', 'message': 'Clean up service version history comments

The service version history comments need to describe what changed
that caused the SERVICE_VERSION to be bumped. This should be an event
like "service does a new thing" or "compute rpc changed". It should not
be a place where we replicate the comment we added to compute/rpcapi.
Several people have just copied the compute-specific comment into this
history, which triggered other people to do the same. It makes it
harder to scan the history and see which version bumps were mechanical,
and which were for more complex events.

This corrects those comments by making them generic, and adds a
bit of help to the block comment above for people that read it.

Change-Id: I4595e72b9de53309a1a6bedc41e7ba31092c580b
'}]
commit_message:
Clean up service version history comments

The service version history comments need to describe what changed
that caused the SERVICE_VERSION to be bumped. This should be an event
like "service does a new thing" or "compute rpc changed". It should not
be a place where we replicate the comment we added to compute/rpcapi.
Several people have just copied the compute-specific comment into this
history, which triggered other people to do the same. It makes it
harder to scan the history and see which version bumps were mechanical,
and which were for more complex events.

This corrects those comments by making them generic, and adds a
bit of help to the block comment above for people that read it.

Change-Id: I4595e72b9de53309a1a6bedc41e7ba31092c580b

No need to # replicate the details from compute/rpcapi.py here. However, for more # complex service interactions, extra detail should be provided # Version 2: Compute RPC version 4.5 # Version 3: Compute RPC version 4.6 # Version 5: Compute RPC version 4.7 # Version 7: Compute RPC version 4.9 # Version 8: Compute RPC version 4.10 # Version 9: Compute RPC version 4.11 # Version 11: Compute RPC version 4.12

commit_message:
Add vcs string to version option output

This commit adds a vcs string to 'tempest --version' output like
'12.0.1.dev122' because it's confusing without vcs when a development
phase, especially.

Change-Id: I4de869c84cefc3e42e8a1416c6deeb29fe72e186

commit_message:
Raise PollsterPermanentError if inspector is not implemented

We don't need to repeatedly call compute pollsters if the underlying
inspector doesn't implemented the relevant inspector method.

Change-Id: I26f5e766e4ff8a663ae036ef365ef8b0926f4408
Closes-Bug: #1598690
